title: Painter
description:
**Painter - County of Bergen** 

**Department of Public Works – Division of General Services**

Under direction of a Crew Supervisor, applies paint, and other coating materials to various surfaces from ground level and/or scaffolds, platforms, and ladders at various heights, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns; follows accepted methods and uses proper materials and/or tools to prepare various surfaces for painting; cares for and cleans standard painting tools; does related work as required.

**Job Responsibilities: (may include but not limited to)**

· May work alone or as a member of a team, on both indoor and outdoor assignments.· Prepares surfaces utilizing various methods which may include sandpaper, wire brushes, or steel wool, and removes loose and old paint from surfaces using paint remover, scrapes, or wire brushes to properly coat, cover and adhere to the surface.· Fills nail holes, cracks, and joints with putty, spackle, or other fillers to make a suitable surface for the finish coat.· Uses premixed paints or prepares paints to match specific colors by mixing required portions of tints and colorants to obtain proper colors, hues, and shades.· Thins, stirs, and mixes paint to obtain proper consistency.· Applies paint or other coating materials to various surfaces with brushes, rollers, and spray guns, and observes that the paint finish meets surface protection requirements.· Applies various coating materials such as varnish, stain, shellac, lacquer, or enamel using brushes and/or other related tools, methods, and techniques to refinish cabinets, desks, chairs, or doors, or to decorate and protect interior or exterior surface, trim, and fixtures of buildings, and other structures.· Paints various surfaces including cramped and hard to reach places, from ladders scaffolds, and platforms at varied heights, using brushes, rollers, or spray guns.· Erects various types of scaffolding such as prefabricated metal or aluminum, wooden and/or swing stages (suspended by ropes or cables attached to roof hooks or outriggers), "A" ladders, window jacks, or ladder jacks, or ladder jacks by following standard methods to paint tall buildings and structures.· Receives oral and written work orders outlining the work to be done and methods to be used to accomplish the job according to specifications.· Cleans and cares for brushes, rollers, and other equipment using water, turpentine, paint thinner, or other cleaning materials.

**Education/Experience Requirements:**

· High School Diploma· Three (3) years of experience in work involving the painting and repainting of the interior and exterior of buildings and structures.

**Schedule:**

· Per Diem

**Other:**

· Valid New Jersey Driver’s License

Please send employment application to resume@co.bergen.nj.us – ***put in subject line job applying for, thank you.***

The County of Bergen is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer.

*It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of The County of Bergen not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, caregiver status, unemployment status or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state and/or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignments, benefits, layoff, and termination.*

Job Type: Part-time

Application Question(s):

* Do you have at least three (3) years of experience in work involving the painting and repainting of the interior and exterior of buildings and structures?

Ability to Relocate:

* Hackensack, NJ 07601: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Fall 2024 Internship - Wholesale / Licensing
description:
**Every Fall Internship Should Feel This Good!**



We’re on the lookout for highly motivated college students, in good academic standing, who are passionate about our brand and working toward a career in the retail industry. Interns will be responsible for assisting in day-to-day operations within their designated department, providing support to other departments as needed, as well as handling administrative tasks throughout the office.


**You will:**


* Support Systems:
	+ Support the input and updating of data in merchandising tools such as Centric
	+ Streamline cross-functionality of sales & design teams by facilitating wholesale B2B custom orders
	+ Monitor wholesale core/BSR assortments cross-season by supporting cross-functional partners (sales, planning, production etc)
	+ Scrub systems & reports for seasonal PO readiness
	+ Assist in supporting the seasonal wholesale buy process through system channel cleanup post-commit
* Support Visually:
	+ Create & compile CAD decks for assortment proposals, investment reviews, and seasonal maintenance of assortment iles
	+ Assist in sample pulling & mock store validation for market
* Support with Analysis/Assorting:
	+ Leverage weekly inventory reporting & analysis to compile relevant incremental assortment proposals
	+ Partner with Sales and Production teams to manage sample ordering and tracking for Wholesale and Collaborations
	+ Help manage seasonal assorting tools with responsibility for maintenance
	+ Build CAD slides for Monday morning focal decks
	+ Complete market research for Custom, Wholesale, Licensing, Events, and Collaborations
* Take on ad-hoc projects as needed


**What you bring:**


* Working towards a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* Experience in Excel (proficiency preferred)
* Detail oriented
* Displays a sense of urgency with directions from others
* Strong interpersonal communication
* Organizational and management skills are essential as well as the ability to multitask and work on multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines
* Competition and industry awareness
* Ability to effectively receive and communicate feedback
* Passion for the vineyard vines brand
* A positive and enthusiastic attitude


**Every-day should feel this good because:**


* We have a fun-entrepreneurial culture filled with truly “good” people
* We offer flexible scheduling and are happy to work around your class schedule
* On occasional Thursday’s we have Bagels and Big Ideas where you can learn something new from executive leaders
* We offer a generous employee discount so you can rep our lifestyle on-and-off the boat


**A few things you should know:**


* This internship is for credit only and you must be able to provide the appropriate paperwork from your school in order to be considered
* Able to come into the office on either Tuesday, Wednesday and/or Thursday (2x a week)
* We work with your class and extracurricular schedule to determine your internship schedule. Please note: we recommend working two full 8 hour days and one 4 hour half day
* The Fall internship can be up to 15 weeks long with a max of 20 hours per week
* Fall internship slated to start the week of September 23, 2024
* With a growing number of applicants each year, this is a highly competitive Internship program. Please feel free to add additional information to your application such as a link to your blog, LinkedIn, your portfolio, or any other relevant project to show your passion!

title: Membership Advisor
description:
**Crunch** **Signature** is a No Judgment Gym that believes in making serious exercise fun by fusing fitness and entertainment.  

  

Looking to combine work, fitness and fun? Working at Crunch is more than a job, it’s an opportunity to inspire others to reach their fitness goals and simultaneously embark on a career in the health & wellness industry. Our ‘No Judgments’ philosophy attracts a diverse and welcoming group of professionals and makes Crunch an amazing company to work for.  

  

Crunch boasts state-of-the-art facilities and mixes fun and fitness to make for the ideal work environment. We have immediate openings for Membership Sales Advisors with a burning desire to succeed. If you are extremely client oriented, highly motivated, love developing a meaningful rapport with your clients and have the ability to communicate with persuasiveness, then you need to apply! This is a great position for a candidate looking to make a significant impact in a growing and dynamic organization. The position offers hourly pay, along with a very competitive bi-weekly commission plan and bonus structure – that translates to one of the best total compensation plans in the fitness industry! The right candidate will also have a great opportunity for upward mobility, as we operate over 400+ facilities nationally.  

  

**Compensation:** Hourly rate up to $20/hr plus opportunity to earn monthly commissions averaging $3k-$5k per month. Earning potential is $75k+  

  

**Benefits/ Perks:**  

  

* Competitive compensation plan of any commercial gym
* Huge GROWTH opportunity across multiple markets
* Continued fitness and sales education – online and in person
* Complimentary gym membership at any nationwide Crunch location
* Great facilities with functional training areas, premier strength equipment, top-of-the-line cardio equipment, best in class Group Fitness, and more
* Benefits for eligible full-time employees including group health insurance, disability insurance, life insurance, 401k with company match and others after meeting waiting period
* Complimentary dotFIT nutrition program
* Complimentary CPR/AED re-certifications
* Monthly Sales contests – team and individual
* Annual Sales contests and recognition
* Discounts on Crunch services, products, and much more!

**Responsibilities:**  

  

* Attract business via member referrals, cold calls, corporate lead generation, territory outreach, telephone inquiries, sales follow up
* Ability to achieve and surpass all personal sales goals
* Perform all functions with the highest levels of integrity and adhere to company core values at all times
* Work closely with team members in driving new member personal training sales
* Maintain an atmosphere that makes all co-workers, members, and guests feel welcomed at all times
* Possess an enthusiastic, passionate, outgoing, friendly and ambitious personality

**Qualifications:**  

  

* 1+ years sales experience preferred
* Strong rapport building skills
* Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly as well as passionate, intelligent and knowledgeable regarding the fitness industry
* Excellent verbal communication skills
* Computer literacy

*Crunch provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Floral Designer
description:
Crossed Keys Estate is seeking a floral designer to arrange wedding florals and decor elements to execute couples’ wedding day visions. The ideal candidate should be creative, attentive to details and have an eye for what would look best within the wedding venue and coordinate with couples’ design goals. Looking for dedicated, team players who are committed to creating beautiful designs to excite clients and guests!  

  

Responsibilities to include:  

* Utilizing creativity and basic floral design knowledge to arrange elements including but not limited to bouquets, corsages, boutonnieres, centerpieces, tablescapes and arbors
* Reviewing, interpreting and executing design plan and recipes determined by client and Lead Designer
* Preparing flowers for arrangement by clipping, hydrating and stocking cold storage
* Transporting and attaching floral designs to large structures such as arches, chuppahs, pedestals, walls, seating charts and beams
* Understanding couple’s overall design vision and ensuring all details are executed according to that vision
* Providing excellent customer service to our couples and their wedding party members when interacting with them on wedding days
* Directing floral setup team members to ensure all floral and decor elements are in place on time according to wedding day timelines
* Maintaining inventory of hard goods (floral containers, candles, etc.)
* Designing and transporting florals for occasional off site weddings
* Ensuring all deliverables match what was described to the client and striving for top notch presentation
* Making quick, minor adjustments to florals on wedding day based on changing weather conditions or client feedback as needed
* Ability to build and secure arrangements and decor elements so they remain intact throughout the duration of an event

Qualifications:  

* Minimum of 4 years experience in floral or event design
* Knowledge of fresh floral product, design techniques and mechanics
* Strong attention to detail
* Must be able to lift up to 50lbs
* Ability to walk/stand for duration of shift

title: Food Service Worker
description:
QC Terme is the leading Italian wellness provider, with 6 spas and 4 spa resorts worldwide. Nine of the spas are located in Italy, and the company opened the first spa outside of Italy in 2018 in Chamonix, France. Our beautiful Spa opened March 2022, come and be part of our fantastic team!

QC Terme spas are experiential destination day spas that are typically fit-out in historical buildings but can be built from the ground up, in unique locations with beautiful views. The spas feature various forms of hydro therapeutic, thermal, and sense-stimulating pools that encompass about 30-35 experiences per spa.

QC NY are seeking passionate, sincere, Food Service Workers, who are able to deliver fantastic food and beverage experiences for our guests. If you are looking to join the best wellness company with outstanding benefits, great hourly wages and full access to all of our beautiful spas in both the US and internationally then please apply below.

Our beautiful NY Spa is located on Governors Island only 8 minutes by ferry. We offer free transport via ferry to the Island. We are offering full time, part time flexible schedules.

**Job Summary:**

The Food Service Ambassador will be accountable for correctly and efficiently preparing and plating an assortment of food items in accordance with assigned work guidelines and menus. The Food Service Ambassador will also set up and prepare complimentary coffee and tea for QC NY guests. The Food Service Ambassador will have general knowledge of food preparation and handling techniques, able to execute various food service assignments and be able to work as a team member as well as work independently with proper direction.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Daily brings food from storage are and properly stores in designated area.
* Follows wrapping, unwrapping, dating and food safety and rotation procedures.
* Performs prep work such as washing, peeling, and cutting.
* Prepares dishes and plates food, following proper food handling procedures.
* Set up and prepare coffee and tea in the morning and monitor and refill as needed throughout the day.
* Cleans work areas, equipment, and utensils.
* Works and communicates actively with bartender to ensure that guests receive correct food order.
* Keeps track of all food waste by filling out food waste log on designated dates.
* Ensures compliance with company service standards and inventory.
* Assures compliance with all sanitation and safety requirements.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Able to safely utilize utensils such as knives, cutting machines etc.
* Able to work long hours as sometimes required.
* Ability to work flexible hours as required including nights, weekends, and holidays.
* Maintain a warm and friendly demeanor at all times.
* Must be able to effectively communicate both verbally and written, with all levels of employees and guests in an attentive, friendly, courteous, and service oriented manner.
* Must be effective at listening to, understanding, and clarifying concerns raised by employees and guests.
* Must be able to multitask and prioritize departmental functions to meet deadlines.
* Approach all encounters with guests and employees in an attentive, friendly, courteous, and service-oriented manner.

**Education and Experience:**

* High School Diploma.
* Hospitality experience preferred.
* Minimum of six months previous food service experience preferred.
* Food Handlers certificate a plus.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Ability to be on your feet for extended periods of time.
* Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at times.

QC Terme, US is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status.

title: Agent Services Coordinator
description:
As the Agent Services Coordinator (ASC), you manage the functions that support the market center’s service to our associates. You are responsible for ensuring operational excellence across all aspects of the office. You focus on associate retention through Gold Standard Customer Service and Unwavering Hospitality.

You are a rapid problem solver who easily and quickly learns from your environment, and appreciates an efficient work structure. You are able to think through a problem or solution in order to present it logically to others and enjoy a variety of responsibilities in a changing environment. You are not typically demanding, strive to cultivate trust and goodwill through effective communication, and are concerned about doing what is right according to the established standards.

* You are a servant leader who is eager to help others achieve and accomplish their goals
* You are highly self-aware and coachable
* You have a keen interest in delivering Gold Standard customer service and the ability to anticipate the needs of others
* You are able to move with a sense of urgency to ensure the associates’ needs are taken care of in a timely manner
* You have proven experience in customer service, making an associate’s problem your problem
* You are a high achiever who wants to make a difference in the lives of others
* You enjoy organization with a continual drive to optimize systems, tools, and technologies
* You have the ability to work effectively under high pressure and strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with different types of individuals
* You have respect for other cultures and deep empathy for others
* You have the ability to both do deep-focused work and be agile, when needed, to thrive in a high-tempo environment, adapt, and respond to day-to-day challenges of the role
* You are resilient and committed to self-care and to modeling this for those around you

What will I be doing?

* You will engage fully in the systems, tools, and conversations of Keller Williams to provide value to the market center associates
* You will ensure the execution of the retention systems designed to preserve and enhance our associate and vendor relationships
* You are accountable for delivering excellent customer service at every level in the market center (associates, visitors, your teammates, etc.)

You will provide attentive service and support to our associates in growing their businesses. This includes (and is not limited to):

* Serve as the primary liaison between associates and the resources of Keller Williams
* Onboarding and orientation for new associates
* Assist with market center events
* Maintenance of office technology: social pages and groups, public website, Google Business page, recruiting sites, agent resources site, etc.
* Drive the use of ancillary services by engaging both new and existing associates to the benefits of using our in-house companies
* Develop a monthly training calendar
* Support the Market Center Leadership team with additional projects as needed

You will be coordinating closely with the Team Leader (TL), the Market Center Administrator (MCA), and the support staff of the market center.  
Qualifications:

* A customer-centric approach, dedicated to providing excellent service to agents and clients
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to build strong relationships with agents and team members
* Proven experience in office operations
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects efficiently
* Demonstrated leadership qualities, including the ability to inspire and empower team members
* Strong proficiency in Google Suite and Microsoft Office tools
* Familiarity with office management, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations
* Tech-savvy
* Proficiency in using social media platforms
* An entrepreneurial mindset, always seeking opportunities to improve processes and support the growth of the market center

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $20.38 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Google Suite: 1 year (Required)
* Microsoft Office: 1 year (Required)
* Customer service: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Englishtown, NJ 07726: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Fall 2024 Internship - Outlet Merchandising
description:
**Every Fall Internship Should Feel This Good!**



We’re on the lookout for highly motivated college students, in good academic standing, who are passionate about our brand and working toward a career in the retail industry. Interns will be responsible for assisting in day-to-day operations within their designated department, providing support to other departments as needed, as well as handling administrative tasks throughout the office.


**You Will:**


* Assist with sample management, seasonal line development, and fitting of garments.
* Learn how to run a retail apparel/non-apparel business.
* Manage inventory, help choose the seasonal line, and create “look books” for the outlet stores.
* Learn basics in retail math to understand selling reports and financial reporting.
* Assist in product development by presenting ideas for on-brand styles for all departments in outlets (men’s, women’s, boys, and girls).
* Work with design to collaborate on color palettes, choosing and developing styles, and sourcing fabrics and trims.


**What you bring:**


* Working towards a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* Strong interpersonal communication
* Ability to plan, manage time, and make decisions in a fast-paced environment
* Organizational and time management skills are essential as well as the ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines
* Competition and industry awareness
* Commitment to career growth of self and others
* Team focused, confident, and professional
* Creative, adaptable, entrepreneurial and driven by integrity


**Every-day should feel this good because:**


* We have a fun-entrepreneurial culture filled with truly “good” people
* We offer flexible scheduling and are happy to work around your class schedule
* On occasional Thursday’s we have Bagels and Big Ideas where you can learn something new from executive leaders
* We offer a generous employee discount so you can rep our lifestyle on-and-off the boat


**A few things you should know:**


* This internship is for credit only and you must be able to provide the appropriate paperwork from your school in order to be considered
* Able to come into the office on either Tuesday, Wednesday and/or Thursday (2x a week)
* We work with your class and extracurricular schedule to determine your internship schedule. Please note: we recommend working two full 8 hour days and one 4 hour half day
* The Fall internship can be up to 15 weeks long with a max of 20 hours per week
* Fall internship slated to start the week of September 23, 2024
* With a growing number of applicants each year, this is a highly competitive Internship program. Please feel free to add additional information to your application such as a link to your blog, LinkedIn, your portfolio, or any other relevant project to show your passion!
company_description: We’re so lucky to be able to do what we love—we have fun, work hard, and meet great people.

title: Vice President, Revenue Operations and Strategy, North America
description:
**Vice President, Revenue Operations and Strategy, North America**


Reports to: Chief Advertising Officer, North America


Location: New York, NY (hybrid, 2 days in office)


The Guardian is a global news organization that delivers fearless, independent journalism. From breaking news and award-winning investigations, to in-depth coverage of technology, sports, film, culture and lifestyle, the Guardian offers a global view that deepens our audiences' understanding of America and the world.


Headquartered in New York City, Guardian US is an entirely digital operation that seeks to engage US readers by combining the Guardian's international coverage with US voices and expertise. Core coverage areas include the climate emergency, economic and racial inequality, digital privacy and much more. Guardian US launched in 2011 and today has bureaus in New York, Washington DC, New Orleans and Los Angeles.


The Guardian is an independently owned, mission-driven organization, funded by readers around the globe. It's the talent, energy and commitment our people bring to The Guardian that make us who we are. Across our business we have some of the most creative thinkers in media and beyond: award winning journalists, cutting edge commercial teams, digital talent and more.


The Guardian US is looking for a **Vice President, Revenue Operations and Strategy, North America** to join our NYC office.


The Vice President of Revenue Operations and Strategy, North America will drive The Guardian's revenue growth initiatives by overseeing sales processes, operations, and strategic development. Reporting to the Chief Advertising Officer, North America, the VP will drive the management and execution of operations, programmatic, account management, pricing, and revenue analytics teams. We're looking for an experienced leader in digital media and publishing who excels in defining strategies, identifying opportunities, and empowering sales teams.


**Key duties & responsibilities:**


* **Revenue Strategy Development:** Collaborate with senior executives to develop and execute strategies for revenue growth, focusing on acquisition, expansion, and retention, while enhancing operational efficiencies.
* **Forecasting and Business Planning:** Oversee revenue planning and goal-setting, developing accurate forecasts to identify and assess business opportunities.
* **Business Intelligence:** Implement regular reporting on key performance metrics for executive and sales teams, including account performance, pipeline management, and brand/product insights.
* **Programmatic Management:** Working with our global team based in London, manage programmatic partnerships and strategically optimize the ad stack to maximize yield and drive substantial revenue growth.
* **Ad Operations:** Manage ad operations workflow, including campaign setup, trafficking, quality assurance, optimization, troubleshooting, and reporting.
* **Account Management:** Enhance support for sales teams by improving workflows and infrastructure, and developing training programs focused on account retention and upselling.
* **Pricing Strategy:** Develop and implement pricing best practices and internal workflows to increase profitability.
* **Yield Optimization:** Create and implement strategies to improve fill rates, CPMs, and revenue across all ad formats and platforms.
* **Account Planning:** Develop and maintain account planning processes to provide business reviews, market opportunities, risks, and areas of focus to optimize revenue planning.
* **Sales Support Processes:** Optimize sales support processes and infrastructure to enhance efficiency, productivity, and revenue growth.Team Leadership: Guide and develop a data-driven revenue operations team, fostering innovation and impact.

**Knowledge & experience:**


* Bachelor's degree (BA or BS) required.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in digital media, with at least 7 years in a leadership role.
* Proven success in a revenue operations function driving sales growth.
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills with the ability to drive results in a matrixed environment.
* Strong executive communication skills with a track record of building consensus across organizational levels.
* Exceptional analytical skills for data-driven decision-making and recommendations.
* Proven ability to address complex organizational problems and develop effective solutions.
* Strategic thinker with attention to detail, capable of managing top-level goals and execution intricacies.
* Adaptable to shifting priorities and capable of making informed decisions amidst ambiguity.

**How to Apply:**


We know there are great candidates who might not check all these boxes or who possess important skills we haven't thought of. If that's you, we encourage you to apply and tell us about yourself.


**All candidates interested in applying should upload a resume and cover letter as one PDF document.**


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* Salary: $225k - 250k with commercial incentive
* 20 days of vacation leave in addition to 11 company holidays
* Unlimited sick time
* 401(k) Match
* Subsidized healthcare coverage including medical, vision, and dental
* Medical and Dependent Flexible Spending Accounts
* Generous parental leave with 100% pay
* Long Term and Short Term Disability insurance
* Life insurance
* Commuter benefits
* Work/Life balance: Flexible hybrid schedule

Culture & Wellbeing:


We want everyone to feel like they belong at the Guardian and we champion diversity of thought. You will also have the opportunity to hear unique insight from our journalists in our morning conference, a live discussion on the news story of the day.


We offer great tools to help you prioritize your wellbeing including a free Headspace subscription and access to Employee Assistance Programs. Headspace is a company that offers evidence-based meditation and mindfulness tools, mental health coaching, therapy, psychiatry, and EAP services.


Learning & Development:


We encourage personal and professional growth. Employees have access to a broad range of tools and solutions, and we are happy to support the pursuit of professional qualifications through vocational courses and apprenticeships.


Sustainability:


Our goal is to become an environmentally regenerative company and we have signed up to a sustainability vision and strategy to reach it. Find more information about sustainability at GNM here.


Guardian News & Media is an equal employment opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, national origin or citizenship.


We value and respect all differences (seen and unseen) in all people at the Guardian. We aspire to have inclusive working experiences and an environment that reflects the audience we serve, where our people have equal access to career development opportunities, their voices are heard and can contribute to our future.


  
Job Number


508


Location


New York, New York, United States


Business Area


Advertising


Employment Type


Full time

title: Technician
description:
**CRUNCH** is a No Judgment Gym that makes serious exercise fun by fusing fitness and entertainment. Are you looking to combine work, fitness, and fun? Working at Crunch is more than a job; it’s an opportunity to inspire others to reach their fitness goals. Our ‘No Judgments’ philosophy attracts a diverse and welcoming group of professionals and makes Crunch an amazing company for which to work.  

  

**SUMMARY**  

No experience is necessary; however, industry experience is a plus. Training is available for those looking to learn a new skill. We are looking for mechanically inclined people who like working with their hands. Our club technicians are responsible for repairing and maintaining our gyms. If you know how to work with hand tools, have a drive to learn, and grow your knowledge base with service manuals, videos, parts lists, and other helpful resources, then Crunch wants you!  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Repair and maintenance equipment submitted in Fitness EMS
* Place orders for parts and/or services in a timely manner while confirming approvals for any costly purchases
* Perform preventative maintenance on all equipment as dated in Fitness EMS or the PM tracking chart
* Ensure club systems are working and contact appropriate service vendors when needed
* Repair and maintenance of all building items reported in the Fitness EMS
* Perform preventative maintenance of all building-related items specified in Fitness EMS or in the PM calendar
* Maintain club systems and overall general building tasks
* Maintain accurate records of all repairs and preventative maintenance in Fitness EMS
* Must have his/her own basic tools and basic knowledge of proper use
* Maintain proper communication with management and co-workers
* Must have working knowledge and understanding of company operating systems with the available use of company-provided mobile devices
* Respond to emergency calls for club support, offering phone support as needed
* Maintain professional manners at all times and dress in proper company uniform
* Assist with club management requests, including, but not limited to, the installation and removal of promotional items, touch-up painting, meetings, etc.
* Understand and follow all company procedures, standards, and guidelines

**Position Requirements**  

* High School Diploma or GED
* Basic computer skills
* Basic knowledge and proper use of hand tools
* Ability to perform physical job duties, including lifting and/or carrying 50-100 lbs.

*Crunch provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Associate Director, Legal
description:
**Summary:**


In this role, you will work within a driven and collaborative legal team and with various other company representatives and outside counsel to provide legal and strategic support across the entire company. This position reports directly to and works closely with the Head of Legal Affairs, and you will have regular interactions with the General Counsel and other senior leaders within the business. You will work on a wide variety of issues, and gain a deep understanding of the numerous legal issues affecting the pharmaceutical industry.

  


**THIS POSITION IS HYBRID: 3 DAYS IN OFFICE; 2 DAYS REMOTE**


**The position will feature the following primary responsibilities:**


* Work closely with the Head of Legal Affairs and other members of the legal team, strategically manage legal issues with and without external counsel, and provide legal advice to business leaders throughout the company.
* Review, draft, and negotiate a variety of legal agreements, including but not limited to customer agreements, R&D agreements, distribution agreements, vendor/service agreements, supply agreements, licensing agreements and M&A agreements, and advise the company in other related transactional matters.
* Provide legal advice to business units across the company, including advice regarding transactions, and regulatory issues.
* When necessary, assist the litigation team in managing litigation and investigation matters, including business disputes and regulatory matters.

  




**Qualifications****:**


* Juris Doctorate, with minimum of 2 years of legal experience in a law firm or in-house. Experience with life sciences preferred but not required.
* Admission to practice in at least one state with ability to secure New Jersey in-house certification.
* Proven track record advising clients.
* Experience in corporate and transactional legal matters.
* Excellent team player who likes to work on a dynamic team, learn and continually evolve.
* Must be comfortable working in a fluid environment. Candidates must be eager to delve into new areas as needed and undertake projects as needed.
* Must have outstanding written and oral communication skills and the ability to think analytically to understand complex, ambiguous problems or issues and articulate solutions/conclusions clearly and concisely. Must be able to communicate effectively with individuals of varying professional, educational and cultural backgrounds and be able to make complex legal concepts accessible to all audiences.
* Must be a business-minded professional who is responsive to client needs and brings a clear pragmatic, solution-driven sensibility coupled with sound judgment.
* Must be hands-on, roll-up-the-sleeves professional with a “can-do” attitude.
* Ability to travel occasionally within the U.S., and occasionally internationally, when required.

  




Actual base compensation may vary based on a number of factors, including but not limited to geographical location and experience. In addition, this position is part of the Annual Performance Bonus Plan, and may be eligible for the Long Term Incentive Plan. Employees are eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs which include medical, dental and vision coverage; life insurance; disability insurance; 401(k) savings plan; flexible spending accounts; and the employee assistance program. Employees also receive various paid time off benefits, including vacation time and sick time.


The compensation and benefits described above are subject to the terms and conditions of any governing plans, policies, practices, agreements, or other materials or documents as in effect from time to time, including but not limited to terms and conditions regarding eligibility. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company, or individual department/team performance, and market factors.


The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees as assigned to this job. Nothing herein shall preclude the employer from changing these duties from time to time and assigning comparable duties or other duties commensurate with the experience and background of the incumbent(s).


We provide equal employment opportunities for all current employees and applicants for employment. This policy means that no one will be discriminated against because of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, nationality, citizenship, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, affectional or sexual orientation, military or veteran status, generic predisposing characteristics or any other basis prohibited by law.

Sun Pharmaceuticals (Sun) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Sun employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Sun. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral.

title: Associate Center Director
description:
**POSITION DESCRIPTION**  

Come join a diverse team committed to empowering youth to transform their cities through an innovative approach that links leadership, faith formation, learning, and the arts: employing local youth to lead after-school programming for school-age children in their own neighborhoods. The Associate Center Director, in conjunction with the Center Director, oversees all programming within the New City Kids: Lafayette After-School Center. The center serves students from 1st-8th grade and the Associate Center Director ensures ongoing high-quality support for students, parents, and in programming. They serve as a primary relational contact for children and parents. This position also includes an administrative role. The Associate Center Director would report to the City Director to support various departments in NCK Jersey City.  

  

**SCOPE & RESPONSIBILITIES**  

* **Goal Achievement:** Track and steward annual department program goals. Submit regular goal reports to Center Director and lead staff to effectively meet program goals.
* **Program Development:** Ensure quality execution of academic, music, and faith-based programming. This includes the extra credit program, elective classes, and community time which will be set forth around biblical and academic themes.
* **School Connectivity:** Develop and maintain relationships with local schools that are attended by ASC students. Partner with schoolʼs to help NCK continue to meet their goals for the students.
* **Programmatic Administration**: Assist Center Director in tracking daily attendance, student report cards, tuition payments, and all other critical data to successful programming.
* **Purchase and Expense tracking:** Track all purchases approved by Center Director and any other expenses to ensure budget spending accuracy.
* **Parental Communication:** Serve as the primary parent contact and oversee daily dismissal in conjunction with the parent liaison.
* **Mentoring and Discipleship:** Build one-on-one relationships with 4 Teen Life Interns.
* **Ambassadorship:** Ensure culture of ambassadorship in After School Center, supporting tours for current and prospective partners.
* **Registration/administration:** Working in tandem with the Center Director, register children for the After School Center, ensure the site is in compliance with state licensing requirements, manage food program and urban league enrollment and logistics. The Associate Center Director would also support the upkeep of data needed both internally and externally through dropbox and google drive, gather information needed for grant purposes, and at times serve as the point person for internal and external communication, along with other administrative tasks.

  

**CRITICAL QUALITIES**  

* **Christian Commitment** – mature person of Christian faith as defined by the Apostleʼs Creed with an active prayer life and church involvement, and aligned with New City Kidsʼ statement of faith: www.newcitykids.org/statement-of-faith
* **Dedicated Team Member** – flexible and willing to complete tasks that fall outside oneʼs job description, and able to make things happen without being micromanaged
* **Emotional maturity** – self-aware, teachable, sensitive to cross-cultural issues, and able to maturely deal with youth from broken contexts.
* **Relational** – enjoys listening spending time with elementary and middle school age kids, and is a professional and mature role model for the ASC students.
* **Persistent** – pursues relationships even with ʻdifficultʼ people with both a Christ-like insistence and gentleness; pursues goals to their completion in the face of challenges
* **Passionate Learner and Teacher** – has an infectious love of learning and transmitting knowledge.
* **Administrative**– can efficiently and effectively complete administrative tasks.
* **Commitment to Excellence** – able to lead multiple long and short-term projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines; attention and care for administrative detail; strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**  

* Constantly moves about the center during programming hours
* Regularly moves music equipment, supplies, and furniture weighing up to 50 pounds.

  

**DETAILS**  

* Hours: 30 hours per week (occasional commitments on evenings)
* Compensation: $22.06/hr

title: Bartender
description:
QC Terme is the leading Italian wellness provider, with 6 spas and 4 spa resorts worldwide. Nine of the spas are located in Italy, and the company opened the first spa outside of Italy in 2018 in Chamonix, France. Our beautiful Spa opened March 2022, come and be part of our fantastic team!

QC Terme spas are experiential destination day spas that are typically fit-out in historical buildings but can be built from the ground up, in unique locations with beautiful views. The spas feature various forms of hydro therapeutic, thermal, and sense-stimulating pools that encompass about 30-35 experiences per spa.

QC NY are seeking passionate, sincere, Bartenders, who are able to deliver fantastic food and beverage experiences for our guests. If you are looking to join the best wellness company with outstanding benefits, great hourly wages and full access to all of our beautiful spas in both the US and internationally then please apply below.

Our beautiful NY Spa is located on Governors Island only 8 minutes by ferry. We offer free transport via ferry to the Island. We are offering full time, part time flexible schedules.

**Job Summary:**

QC NY Bartenders are responsible for our customers’ beverage and food experiences. Bartenders are responsible for ensuring the bars are clean and tidy when guests arrive, presenting drink options, serving beverages and food. Bartenders will need to be quick and energetic and have a polite and friendly attitude. If you enjoy talking to people and thrive in a fast-paced workplace, our Spa is for you!

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Prepare alcohol or non-alcohol beverages for spa guests.
* Prepare and plate food and take food orders.
* Interact with customers, take orders make drinks and prepare food.
* Assess customers’ needs and preferences and make recommendations.
* Mix ingredients to prepare cocktails.
* Plan and present food and beverage menu.
* Check customers’ identification and confirm it meets legal drinking age.
* Restock and replenish bar, food inventory and supplies.
* Stay guest focused and nurture an excellent guest experience.
* Comply with all food and beverage regulations.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Prior experience as a bartender and server.
* Excellent knowledge of in mixing, garnishing and serving drinks.
* Computer literacy.
* Positive attitude and excellent communication skills.
* Ability to keep the bar organized, stocked and clean.
* Able to work long hours as sometimes required.
* Ability to work flexible hours as required including nights, weekends, and holidays.
* Possession of or the ability to possess all state required work cards.

**Education and Experience:**

* High school diploma or GED preferred. College, culinary or bartending education beneficial.

**Physical Requirements:**

title: Social Services Marketing Specialist
description:
**OUTREACH PROFESSIONAL** 

**Location:** Tri-State Area, Brooklyn NY based - 1 day per week required in-office

**Position Overview:**  
As an Outreach Professional for Home and Community Based Services (HCBS), you will play a pivotal role in expanding our service offerings by reaching out to various facilities including hospitals, shelters, community centers, and other relevant organizations. Your primary responsibility will be to market our HCBS programs and establish partnerships with these entities to promote awareness and access to our services. This position requires strong communication skills, strategic thinking, and a passion for improving the lives of individuals in need of supportive care.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Outreach and Relationship Building:**

* Proactively identify and engage with potential partner organizations, including hospitals, shelters, rehabilitation centers, and other healthcare facilities.
* Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders such as administrators, social workers, discharge planners, and other decision-makers within these facilities.
* Collaborate with partner organizations to understand their needs and tailor our HCBS offerings to meet their requirements effectively.

**2. Marketing and Promotion:**

* Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies to promote awareness of our HCBS programs among target audiences.
* Create compelling marketing materials, presentations, and proposals to showcase the benefits and value of our services.
* Organize and participate in networking events, conferences, and community outreach activities to enhance visibility and generate referrals.

**3. Education and Training:**

* Provide education and training sessions to staff members and clients of partner organizations to ensure they are well-informed about our HCBS programs and eligibility criteria.
* Offer ongoing support and resources to facilitate the referral and enrollment process for individuals in need of our services.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, social work, public health, or related field (preferred).
* Proven experience in outreach, sales, marketing, or community engagement roles, particularly within the healthcare or social services sector.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport and collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and persuasively.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, as well as part of a collaborative team environment.
* Passionate about making a positive impact in the community and advocating for individuals in need of supportive services.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary starting at $60,000
* Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance and paid time off.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the organization.
* Fulfilling work environment dedicated to improving the quality of life for vulnerable populations.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $30.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* marketing for healthcare: 2 years (Required)
* sales/outreach: 1 year (Required)
* HCBS (Home and Community Based Services): 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Dog Kennel Attendant
description:
K9 Resorts, the industry leader in luxury boarding and dog daycare is looking for a Pet Care Technician (Kennal Attendant/Playroom Attendant). This person should love dogs and upon successful completion of training, you can even bring your beloved to work with you for free! We are looking for employees that are interested in career progression as we build out this franchise into a multi-unit franchise across New York.

**ABOUT YOU:**

* You love dogs.
* You’re fast paced, self-driven with a strong sense of urgency.
* You’re organized and detail oriented.
* You thrive when you have multiple challenges on your plate.
* You like to work with others and build a teamwork consensus
* You’re lively, enthusiastic and a very strong communicator.

**IF YOU ARE SEEING YOURSELF IN THESE WORDS, WE’D LOVE TO TALK TO YOU ABOUT OUR PET CARE TECHNICIAN ROLE/KENNEL ATTENDANT ROLE.**

**Title: Pet Care Technician/KENNEL ATTENDANT**

**Reports to: General Manager / Resort Owner**

Pet Care Technicians are responsible for delivering on our core promises: cleanliness, and compassionate care. This position spends the most time directly in contact with our furry friends. Someone in this position not only must love dogs, they must also be willing to “get down and dirty”. Cleaning accommodations, giving dog baths, and managing doggie daycare are all part of the daily routine. You must excel at communication and observation skills, as well as possess a keen eye for detail. Some weekend and holiday hours are required.

***Essential Job Functions:***

* Responsible for the health and well-being of dogs in Daycare and Boarding; A keen eye toward dog body language is a plus
* Responsible for the sanitation of all accommodations and outdoor areas, bathing, and monitoring daycare
* Performs body checks on to search for pre-existing conditions and/or injuries
* Able to use down time effectively

***Qualifications:***

* Must complete K9 Resorts Certification Program for a Pet Care Technician

***Education and Experience:***

* High School diploma or equivalent
* Previous experience is preferred but not required
* Some weekend and holiday hours are required

***Technical skills:***

* Ability to lift 50lbs

***Personal Characteristics:***

* Must be able to communicate with all types of people, remain calm, mediate, and problem solve.
* Well-organized and efficient
* Must be of moral and ethical character
* Ability to multitask
* A Can-Do - It is my job attitude
* Outgoing, positive, enthusiastic personality
* Must demonstrate a love for dogs

**Application Question(s):**

* What excites you the most about this position?
* How does your previous experience make you a good fit for this position?
* Do you own a dog?

**Company Description**

Ritz Barklton Holdings is a multi-unit franchisee of K9 Resorts Luxury Pet Hotels that is looking to grow its footprint across Long Island and is seeking individuals that want to be a part of a growing business with opportunities for advancement as we expand.

K9 Resorts Luxury Pet Hotel (http://www.k9resorts.com) strives to offer the best pet care experience for all the dogs in its care and was honored with the 2019 IBPSA Pet Care Business Excellence Award. Founded in 2005, each K9 Resort is custom-designed with hospital-grade ventilation systems, antimicrobial flooring, cage-free luxury boarding, and world-class, professionally trained staff members. Recommended by numerous pet professionals and several major publications, K9 Resorts is proud to lead the way in the pet hospitality industry.

**Benefits**

We offer a discount on all services, free dog daycare when onsite working, employee discounts on nationally recognized brand-name products and services and local retailers, and paid vacation (for F/T Management only).

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY
  
Creative Culinary Management Company (“CCMC”) is a hospitality company founded in 2020 by Jean-Georges Restaurant Holding Company. Based in New York City’s Seaport in Lower Manhattan, CCMC is responsible for the management of a variety of acclaimed restaurants at the Seaport, each offering unique, world-class dining. CCMC’s mission is to channel its team’s extensive knowledge and passion for hospitality into the creation of memorable guest experiences—from family-friendly dining on the historic cobblestones to intimate waterfront restaurants on Pier 17, along with rooftop dining concepts featuring one-of-a-kind views of Lower Manhattan, and an extensive selection of globally-influenced drinking and dining establishments throughout the Tin Building by Jean-Georges—the a 53,000-square-foot culinary marketplace at Pier 17 on the former site of the Fulton Fish Market.
  
  

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
  
The Tin Building by Jean-Georges is a sprawling food emporium located inside one of New York’s most historic landmarks. The TIN Building features multiple unique venues: Several full-service restaurants, fast casual, and counter dining outlets as well as 10,000 sf of retail featuring private label products, grab and go, grocery and more. To support this significant operation the Marketplace features a large commissary kitchen and bakery, as well as an exhibition kitchen that will provide media opportunities.
  
  

The Howard Hughes Corporation, the nationally recognized real estate company overseeing the re-development of New York City’s Seaport District, envisions the repositioning of the property as a magnet for attracting locals and visitors alike with a unique, year-round blend of entertainment, food, and retail offerings. The centerpiece of the Seaport District’s renaissance is an entirely re-imagined historic TIN Building, featuring a one-of-a-kind Marketplace and entertainment venue operated by renowned chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten.
  
  

**POSITION SUMMARY:**  

The Retail Sales Specialist is responsible for promoting and selling retail products and services to customers while delivering an exceptional guest experience. This role serves as a subject matter expert on the product assortment across the Retail department, greets and builds relationships with customers, assists with all inquiries, and drives retail sales. This individual plays an integral role in fostering an excellent customer shopping experience and aims for repeat business.
  
  

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
  
* Greet and welcome guests as they explore the retail spaces, creating a positive and inviting atmosphere.
* Actively interact with guests and recommend products and restaurants with checkout items.
* Assist guests in selecting and recommending products that meet their needs and preferences.
* Provide product information, features, and benefits to help customers make informed purchasing decisions.
* Operate cash registers and process transactions accurately, following company policies and procedures.
* Maintain a clean and organized sales floor, ensuring products are well-displayed and shelves are stocked.
* Collaborate with team members to achieve sales targets and contribute to the overall success of the store.
* Stay up to date on product knowledge, promotions, and sales events to provide accurate information to customers.
* Handle guest inquiries, complaints, and returns professionally and effectively.
* Participate in training programs to continuously improve product knowledge and customer service skills.
* Upsell and cross-sell products to enhance the customer experience and maximize sales opportunities.
* Work with the retail management team to implement merchandising and visual display guidelines.
* Assist with inventory management, including restocking shelves and conducting periodic stock checks.
* Follow all safety and security protocols to ensure a safe shopping environment for customers and staff.
* Operate cash registers and process transactions in a timely and effective manner.
* Oversee and maintain high cleanliness standards for cashier work area.
* Follow all organizational procedures for products displayed near/at the cash register area.
* Follow proper cash handling procedures.
* Present and cross utilize products to enhance the guest experience and maximize sales opportunities.
* Perform all other tasks as duties as assigned and/or per business need.


**KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:**  

* Minimum 1 year of experience as a Retail Salesperson and/or relevant equivalent experience in customer service.
* Prior grocery, culinary, hospitality or specialty food experience preferred.
* Exceptional guest service and interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication.
* Ability to remain organized in a fast paced, hands-on environment.
* Basic math skills for processing transactions.
* Availability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends, nights, and holidays, as required.
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
* Professional demeanor and polished appearance.
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
* Strong work ethic and customer-focused approach.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, and holidays.
* Must be passionate, entrepreneurial, and dedicated to success.
* Maintain a professional appearance by adhering to the organization's grooming and uniform standards.


**REQUIREMENTS:**  

* Ability to perform the essential job functions consistently, safely, and successfully with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
* Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards.
* Ability to lift and carry items weighing 10 – 30 pounds on a regular basis and up to 50 pounds on a regular (or occasional basis).
* Ability to stand for prolong periods of time.
* Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly frequent movements from place to place within the property. Bend, lift, carry, reach/extend arms, and hands above shoulder height frequently, or otherwise move in a constantly changing environment.
* Climbing steps regularly.


The base pay range for this position is between $18 - $25 per hour. The determination of what a specific employee in this job classification is paid depends on a number of factors, including, but not limited to, prior employment history/job-related knowledge, qualifications and skills, etc.
  
Creative Culinary Management is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Associate Trader - Basketball
description:
As an Associate Trader - Basketball at Fanatics Betting & Gaming (FBG), you are here to join the growing Trading team and help us create an entertaining betting proposition that appeals to Fanatics customers.


Reporting into one of the Basketball Trading Managers, you will be an important team player, assisting Traders with various tasks including data analysis, creating new markets and testing features. Whatever your background, keeping the customer and colleague experience at the heart of everything you do is vital to succeed in this role.  



**Responsibilities**

* Work across the Trading department to help the Traders with various tasks
* Perform data analysis to determine the probability of various sporting events occurring, create new markets and settle markets
* Help to test new sportsbook features and trading models, as well as provide input with the wider team
* Ensure BetFanatics’ prices are accurate at all times
* Contribute to continuous improvement across the Trading department
* Work closely with Commercial, Marketing, Product, Engineering and Operations teams to create and implement a best-in-class, intuitive, and scalable betting experience for our customers - driven by data, user research, and competitor analysis
* Ensure that Fanatics are putting the customer at the heart of our Trading strategies
* Assisting other teams within the department where necessary
Open to regular travel to events and other Fanatics offices for various offsite and team meetings  
* 

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
* Entry Level Position, 0 - 2 years of experience
* A real passion for sport, and an inherent understanding of what sports fans want in order to be entertained.
* Ability to understand and interpret data, translating that data into prices
* Ability to test sportsbook platforms and help develop and test trading models
* Preference to work in an entrepreneurial, hyper growth environment where decisions are made quickly
* Team-first mentality, with a willingness to do what it takes to get the job done and effectively work cross-functionally across different teams at FBG and the larger Fanatics organization
* Willingness to ask question and learn along with strong problem solving skills
* Flexible work schedule will be required, including some evenings, weekends, and occasional holidays
This role is based out of the US, UK or Canada  
* 

*If you possess some of these skills but not all of them, we still encourage you to apply!*

The hourly range for this role is $26.44 per hour - $43.75 per hour, depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This role is eligible for the Fanatics Betting and Gaming and an equity award.


* Salary range is listed in USD; ranges will change based on country of residence

In addition to the base, bonus, and equity, full-time employees are eligible for Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, paid time off and other benefits like GymPass, Pet Insurance, Family Care Benefits, Free Shipt deliveries, and more. We’ll also give you $500 to set up your home office!


For information about our benefits, please visit https://benefitsatfanatics.com/

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


As a full-time Verizon Retail Sales Associate, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career with a team focused on unlocking your full potential and sales success within one of our retail stores. Here's what you can expect:

* Generate retail sales by using your passion for cutting-edge technology, and exceptional customer service to expand the Verizon network.
* Learn and uncover customers' needs by creating connections and asking the right questions.
* Position product insights and solution recommendations to provide customers with a complete top-down sales solution.
* Close sales by using phenomenal communication skills to fulfill customer needs with simple and intuitive tech solutions.
* Continuously develop yourself through ongoing training and up-skill in operational functions across merchandising and inventory.
* Potential to grow your customer base by placing outbound calls and sending text messages to current Verizon customers who are interested in our products and services.
* Opportunities to engage with the community outside of the store to expand your loyal customer base, including at off-site Verizon sponsored events.


We’re hiring immediately and this isn't your average entry-level position! Whether you're early in your career or a seasoned sales professional, join today and earn from $49,000 to $59,000 a year, which includes base pay and target individual-based commission. Planning to go above and beyond? Our commission program allows unlimited opportunity which could allow top earners to make an extra $10,000 or more per year in addition to the compensation range quoted earlier. Compensation varies by geography and performance.


Our comprehensive benefits (starting day one) and perks are designed to help you move forward in your career and in your life outside of Verizon. From health and well-being benefits to investment in your education and career, we've got you covered!

* Best in class medical, dental, and vision
* Verizon 401(k) plan with matching contributions up to 6% of eligible participant contributions to the plan, qualified student loan repayments, or a combination of both (effective January 1, 2024)
* $2,500 stock grant per year, part of Verizon's Stock Together award program
* Sales recognition programs that have, in the past, awarded top performers with all inclusive travel to domestic and international destinations, gifts, and other incentives
* Five weeks of paid time off (vacation, holidays, personal days)
* 8 weeks of paid parental leave for eligible new parents (for new moms, when paired with short-term disability, this benefit provides up to 16 weeks of paid time-off)
* Up to $8K per year in tuition assistance
* Discounts up to 50% off on Verizon products and services
* Additional employee discounts on attractions, automotive, travel and more.


Too good to be true? Hear from our Verizon Retail Team Members on what it's like to be part of a team that invests in you. From our in-person new hire experience and award-winning training programs to our inclusive culture of learning and amazing benefits, you'll be able to apply your skills while elevating your career.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You’ll need to have:

* High school diploma or GED.
* One or more years of work experience.
* Willingness to work evenings, weekends, and holidays (you'll know your schedule four weeks in advance).
* Openness to pick up additional shifts and earn more income, typically during the summer months, November through December, and/or during peak vacation periods.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Experience working in a commission-based environment.
* Demonstrated sales experience communicating with customers to find solutions.
* Customer service experience.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **After you apply…**


You may be required to take an assessment. It takes about 20 minutes to complete. If you’re selected to move forward, one of our recruiters will reach out to tell you more about the role and answer your questions.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this worksite-based role, you'll work onsite at a defined location(s).### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

title: Installation and Repair Technician
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing…**

  

Getting our New Jersey customers connected to America’s fastest and most reliable network! You’ll be out and about in the neighborhoods we serve, installing, testing, repairing and maintaining the technology that keeps millions of customers connected.  

  

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

* Connecting, disconnecting, testing, repairing, maintaining equipment, inside wiring and wires at poles, underground or building terminals.
* Placing, removing or repairing copper wiring, fiber optic or cable between poles, buildings.
* Performing splicing operations in connection with installing, rearranging and repair of plant facilities.
* Installing, repairing, maintaining, and testing access lines for all types of equipment and technology.
* Reading and interpreting engineering plans and vendor specifications.
* Climbing ladders, working aloft, perceiving differences in wire and cable colors, and moving/lifting items generally not exceeding 100 lbs.
* Working evenings, weekends, holidays and unscheduled shifts as determined by the needs of the business.

### **What we’re looking for…**

  

You know telecommunications technology and are anxious to put your knowledge and skills to work on Verizon’s network. You like to be busy and well-organized to stay on top of things. You know that the whole team needs to work together to win—and you take pride in a job well done.

### **You’ll need to have:**

* Valid state driver’s license with a satisfactory driving record.

### **Even better if you have one or more of the following:**

* A related Associate Degree or 2 or more years of relevant work experience.

title: Early Childhood Aide Instructor
description:
Do you want to make a difference in a young child’s life? Join the DDI, Early Childhood Services team where best practices are utilized to provide superior education and therapeutic services for children who present with developmental delays.



Various shifts available between 8:00a-3:30p. We are looking to recruit Teacher Assistants for our EC Learning Centers. All TAs are offered on-going trainings and support provided by experts in the field of education. Our classroom are enriched with “State of the Art" materials to meet the needs of our students with outdoor learning areas. School programs are 12 month calendar with 9 weeks of vacation. We offer the opportunity to work in a self-contained setting utilizing the principles of ABA with Autism Spectrum Disorder.



Pay Range: $16.15 - $19.38 / hour


### **Responsibilities:**


* Set up and maintain classroom materials and supplies
* Assist with bussing at arrival and dismissal
* Follow lead of classroom teacher
* Implement outlined behavior treatment plans
* Supervise children during classroom activities
* Demonstrate knowledge of outlined curriculum and IFSP/IEP goals
* Assist children in all daily living activities
* Work collaboratively with classroom staff and team members
* Other duties as assigned

### **Essential Functions:**


* Must be able to modify the area to secure the safety of children
* Ability to move/transport a child weighing up to 30 pounds to a height of 3 feet to place child on changing table
* Must be able to move quickly after a child up to 200 feet to prevent elopement
* Must be able to position self or maneuver classroom to facilitate student instruction in classroom and playground environment
* Must have ability to follow oral and written directions and detect/respond to fire alarms
* Must be able to ascend and descend stairs with railing

### **Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma required
* Minimum 6 college credits
* Must possess NYS Level I Teaching Assistant certification within 6 months from entering this position


*DDI is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees without regard to actual or perceived race, color, sex, pregnancy, reproductive decision making, gender expression or identity, national origin, disability, military status, creed, religion, age, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence or any other group protected by federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating a deep sense of belonging and a culture where all applicants and employees feel welcomed, valued and respected. We are people inspired by purpose.*

title: Program Development Specialist Community Service - ADV Housing
description:
**Program Development Specialist Community Service**

**Department of Human Services Division of Alternatives to Domestic Violence**

Under direction, the Housing Navigator will oversee the Domestic Violence Housing First initiative, assist with temporary emergent placements and other housing/case-management initiatives, coordinates and supports domestic violence survivors in locating and accessing safe and affordable housing; does other related duties as required.

**Responsibilities**: *(may include but not limited to)*

· Meets with concerned groups to determine their needs.

· Identifies and develops relationships with community organizations, landlords, realtors, and government partners, to encourage collaboration and build partnerships.

· Facilitates, reviews and assesses use of funds to support concerned groups.

· Acts as coordinator with statewide coalition, and other programs/groups.

· Provide special training programs and information for professionals in the community working with local concerned groups.

· Represents the County at community meetings.

· Prepares correspondence; data collection, prepares reports.

· Will be required to learn to utilize various types of electronic and/or manual recording and information systems used by the agency, office, or related units.

**Schedule:**

· Full-time. Mobile advocacy component included.

· Availability for weekend hours as necessary.

**Education/Experience:**

· Bachelor’s degree.

· At least five (5) years of experience housing, domestic violence, or related social justice field.

* Knowledge about domestic violence and the impact of violence and trauma on survivors and their children.
* Understanding of the systemic nature of oppression, particularly the intersection of gender, race, and class and how this can affect housing.
* Extensive knowledge of housing resources and options, public benefits, and community resources to meet various survivor needs.
* Demonstrated history of contributing to a healthy and collaborative team culture.
* Ability to engage in constructive self-care activities to manage and prevent secondary and vicarious trauma.

**Other**:

· Strong written and verbal communication skills

* Bi/multilingualism, Spanish/English, strongly preferred.
* Ability to work in a multi-task environment and accept interruptions while performing duties.
* Problem solving and analytical abilities.
* Ability to work well under pressure and deal appropriately with crisis and stress situations.
* Valid NJ Driver’s License.

Please send employment application to resume@co.bergen.nj.us – ***put in subject line job applying for, thank you.***
