title: Behavioral Health Care Manager
description:
**BRIEF POSITION DESCRIPTION:**

The behavioral health care manager is responsible for coordinating and supporting mental health care within a clinical setting and for coordinating referrals to clinically indicated services outside the clinic. The behavioral health care manager may provide evidence-based treatments or work with other mental health providers when such treatment is indicated. This job description provides a comprehensive list of the duties and responsibilities required of a behavioral health care manager.

**JOB DESCRIPTION:** 

Part-Time Behavioral Health Care Manager (Collaborative Care Model)

Location: Long Island, NY (Senior Living Communities)

Position: Part-Time Behavioral Health Care Manager

Organization: Seniority Healthcare

Reports to: Clinical Director / Behavioral Health Director

Potential for Growth: This part-time role has the potential to transition into a full-time position with full benefits.

**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a compassionate and experienced Behavioral Health Care Manager to join our team in a part-time capacity. This role focuses on providing behavioral health support within a Collaborative Care Model for senior residents living in various Senior Living Communities throughout Long Island, NY. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in integrating behavioral health care into primary care settings and ensuring the mental well-being of seniors in our care.

The behavioral health care manager coordinates the overall effort of the group and ensures effective communication among team members. Behavioral health care managers are typically nurses, psychologists, social workers or licensed counselors, but the ability to perform the tasks that need to be completed and creating a tailored plan for who will do each of those tasks is much more important than one's credentials.

A behavioral health care manager is not the same as a case manager or a behavioral health consultant. A full-time behavioral health care manager typically oversees 100-150 patients, depending on how the program is structured. Effective behavioral health care managers support the Primary Care Physician/Clinician (PCP) in his/her role by coordinating treatment, providing proactive follow-up of treatment response, alerting the PCP when the patient is not improving, supporting medication management, and facilitating communication with the psychiatric consultant regarding treatment changes. They also offer brief counseling (using evidence-based techniques such as motivational interviewing, behavioral activation, and problem-solving treatment) and help facilitate changes in treatment if patients are not improving as expected.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Care Coordination: Serve as the primary point of contact for behavioral health needs, coordinating care between seniors and their respective families, primary care providers, community staff, and psychiatric consultants.

Assessments & Screenings: Conduct initial and follow-up behavioral health assessments, including standardized screenings (e.g., PHQ-9, GAD-7, MMSE, etc.).

Care Planning: Develop and implement individualized care plans in collaboration with the primary care team, psychiatric consultant,bgnh78 and senior residents.

Evidence-Based Interventions: Provide brief, evidence-based interventions (e.g., problem-solving therapy, behavioral activation) as appropriate for seniors in need of support.

Collaborative Consultation: Regularly consult with psychiatric providers to review cases, adjust care plans, and enhance the mental health outcomes of senior residents.

Outcome Monitoring: Track and document treatment progress and outcomes, ensuring timely follow-ups and adjustments in care plans.

Communication & Advocacy: Facilitate clear communication between residents, families, senior living community staff, and the care team regarding treatment plans, goals, and available resources.

Education & Training: Provide education to staff at senior living communities on recognizing behavioral health needs and when to refer residents for specialized care.

**Qualifications:**

Education: Master’s degree in social work, counseling, psychology, or a related behavioral health field.

Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in behavioral health care management, preferably in a primary care, geriatrics, or collaborative care setting.

Skills: Strong understanding of the Collaborative Care Model, excellent communication skills, and proficiency in behavioral health assessments and interventions.

Technology: Experience with electronic health records (EHR) and remote care coordination tools is preferred.

**Work Environment:**

This position requires traveling between different senior living communities within the Long Island area.

Flexible part-time hours, with the potential for growth into a full-time role based on performance and program expansion.

**Benefits:**

Competitive hourly wage.

Potential for transition to full-time employment with benefits including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and continuing education support.

**How to Apply:**

Interested candidates should submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their experience and interest in this role to Seniority Healthcare with the subject line “Behavioral Health Care Manager Application.”

**ABOUT SENIORITY HEALTHCARE:**

Seniority Healthcare, a transformational evolution of CCS Healthcare, was born out of a visionary idea in 2016. Our founders were guided by a mission to revolutionize elderly care, with a focus on creating a more compassionate and comprehensive healthcare system for seniors, particularly those grappling with physical and mental disabilities.

Our founders observed that the rising senior population was underserved in the United States, with many individuals unfortunately falling through the healthcare system's gaps. These vulnerable individuals often experienced the harsh consequences of multiple hospitalizations, medical procedures, and a fragmented care system. This observation sparked a determination to effect a paradigm shift in senior healthcare.

To rectify this, we embarked on an ambitious journey to design a better healthcare delivery system for seniors. Our team developed a progressive care model that involved frequent primary care visits for patients managing multiple chronic diseases, supplemented by the convenience and immediacy of telehealth services.

In a significant milestone in 2018, we expanded our capabilities by integrating psychiatric services into our offerings. This strategic addition reinforced our commitment to holistic care, enabling us to cater not only to our patients' medical needs but also to their emotional well-being.

While we have an unwavering commitment to our patients, we also deeply care for the health and wellbeing of our team members. We firmly believe that the well-being of our staff directly translates to the quality of patient care. The existing healthcare landscape, dominated by corporations often prioritizing profits over patients, can sometimes strain the crucial relationship between the healthcare team and their patients. We aim to counter that trend.

At Seniority Healthcare, we champion a work culture that celebrates work-life balance and offers fair wages. We take pride in having accomplished this without any external investment, enabling us to stay true to our core mission: putting patients first, always.

Our reach extends to patients in Senior Living Communities and their homes, catering to their needs in the familiar comfort of their surroundings. We now serve patients across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Delaware, bringing our unique blend of care to their doorsteps. Our approach has significantly reduced the need for hospitalizations, providing patients the comfort and safety they deserve.

We are immensely proud of our unwavering dedication to our patients and their families. As we continue to grow, our commitment remains the same: To provide superior care that respects our patients' dignity and enhances their quality of life. Seniority Healthcare is not just a healthcare provider; it's a beacon of hope, a pledge of commitment, and a promise of care that enriches lives.

We are a well-established property management company dedicated to providing exceptional living experiences for our residents in New York City. We are seeking a dedicated and reliable Full-Time Live-In Superintendent to oversee and maintain our properties, ensuring that they remain in top condition and that tenant needs are promptly addressed.

***Mendham, NJ Family! (#8030)***

**Looking for Nanny to Start:** *ASAP!*

$1,000 to $1,100 per week *+ PAID Vacation, PAID Holidays & PAID Personal Days*

**Time For Some FUN!** *This sweet Mendham family’s ideal nanny would be very loving, patient, compassionate, and organized! They are seeking a nanny who will be an extra set of hands for mom during the day! They would also love assistance with meal preparation and children’s laundry. Finding a nanny who understands/ has experience with cognitive delays in children would be a huge bonus!*

**Toddler boy:** Once he gets to know you, he is very outgoing and friendly! He attends occupational therapy at home 3 times per week for speech and developmental delays. They family would love for the nanny to be there for therapy and work on therapist recommendations as well! He is delayed in feeding and takes a bottle still. He does enjoy pretzels and veggies straws! He generally naps from 11:30am to 2:00pm! He does have some developmental delays which he is in therapy for! He takes MiraLAX in a bottle once a day but does not have any other known allergies or health concerns!

**7 month old girl:** The nanny’s main responsibility will be with her while mom attends therapies with her brother during the day! Mom would love to find someone who will be very interactive with her and focus on developmental milestones as well as facilitating feeding and sleep schedules during the day!

**Schedule:** Ideally, the family would like for the nanny to start as soon as possible! The flexibility to occasionally come early or stay late is nice to have! The family will be paying in cash. Mom is looking for a mommy helper so she will be at home during the day and will continue to be very hands on! Driving will not be needed at this time!

**Wishes:**  The family is looking for a loving, compassionate, and organized nanny who will be an extra set of hands for mom during the day! They would also love assistance with meal preparation and children’s laundry. Finding a nanny who understands cognitive delays in children would be a huge bonus!

title: Furniture & Mattress Sales Representative
description:
Love where you work! At Value City Furniture, we take pride in giving our guests the very best experience when they shop with us. With a warm greeting and a big smile, every day is an opportunity to turn first time shoppers into loyal, life-long customers!

Our Sales teams stride to give our guests an honest, low pressure, and satisfying shopping experience. We thoroughly enjoy helping our guests fulfill their home furnishing and bedding needs!

We are looking to expand our team of positive, ambitious employees!

We recognize and appreciate all of our employee’s hard work and dedication. As a Sales Representative you will have unlimited earnings potential comprised of a lucrative commission structure, bonuses, company-wide acknowledgement & appreciation luncheons for top performers, along with other incentives.

We offer 4 full weeks of paid hands on training. After that, be prepared for the pathway to earning between $42,000 and $80,000+ annually!

If you're goal driven, motivated by money and interested in a job where you are compensated for all of the hard work you put in, then this fast paced environment is the right fit for you!

**Job Responsibilities and Requirements**

* Greet and engage with customers to uncover their home furnishing and bedding needs by helping their visions become a reality
* Provide exceptional customer service and an unforgettable shopping experience that encourages the guest to purchase with us today and come back again for future needs
* Build rapport with customers with your extensive product and inventory knowledge
* Follow up with customers throughout the process and stay in close communication with updates on their order up until delivery
* Gain knowledge of procedures and policies that foster an environment of structure and respect among peers in the workplace
* Maintain a “Team-Player” mentality at all times through positivity, and rapport with both the customer and coworkers
* Meet/exceed goals set by management
* Take part in company-wide training sessions that are both informative and fun
* Must be able to travel to other locations for training

**Full Time Schedule Expectations**

Scheduled to work a minimum of 40 hours per week including Saturdays and Sundays; the number of hours worked will increase during holidays or blackout periods, or for coverage needs.

Scheduled for two days off each week, except during holidays or blackout periods.

**Benefits and Perks**

* **Full Time**
* Paid training
* Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* 401(K) Matching
* Paid Vacation
* PTO
* Employee Discount
* Flexible Schedule

**Part Time Schedule Expectations**

Scheduled to work a minimum of 20 hours a week. Must work one weekend day/night and one full 8 hour shift. Must work Holidays and when coverage is needed the most.

Must work 30 hours a week for health benefits. Must work 40 hours a week to be eligible for Dental, Vision and 401k.

* PTO
* Employee Discount
* Flexible Schedule

Value City Furniture is proud to be an Equal Employment workplace.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Driver's License (Required)

title: Territory Rep: Business Development
description:
**This is the perfect job for an experienced recruiter / wholesaler seeking the uncapped earning potential of a financial sales career with the security of a base salary from an established company.**

**Please only apply if you are serious about a career in business development. This is not a portfolio management or financial advisory role.**

**Who We Are:**

Kingsview Wealth Management is a fast growing independent advisory partnership offering clients financial planning, investment management, tax and insurance services. Over the last few years, we've grown rapidly, serving thousands of clients while establishing a nationwide footprint. We are focused on growth and need highly motivated winners to add to our team.

**Overview:**

Imagine working in a sales environment surrounded by successful, motivated, thoughtful, and passionate individuals committed to improving investor's lives. As a member of our advisory recruitment and business development team, you engage face to face and over the phone with Financial Advisors that work in corporate banking environments to help them understand the benefits of affiliating with an independent firm. This is a traveling sales and recruitment job. Using consultative techniques, you’ll determine their goals and educate them on our services. You will be the liaison between a prospective recruit and us - enhancing both the services our new partners can offer their clients, their financial future and our overall growth.

**The Opportunity:**

Through hands-on experience, training, and mentoring, your personal development in the role is exponential. Surrounded by professionals, you will grow your sales skills, build relationships within the firm, and control your career path. The Business Development position is both a rewarding and engaging role. Bringing a financial advisor back to our home office for a due diligence visit is a victory.

Watch your name move up the rankings as you help provide us with a chance to better a prospective client’s future. This is a commission-driven position with a base salary. Our structure is the perfect mix that comes from the comfort of guaranteed income with the possibility that accompanies uncapped, performance-based commission.

Simply put: You set your career path and control your success

**Your Qualifications:**

* No prior sales experience or industry knowledge required
* Successful Business Development staff demonstrate the following:
* You've set and accomplished goals in the past, personal or professional.
* A desire to be the first impression and advocate of our brand.
* An activist to promote our unique way of looking at the finance industry.
* Educate potential partners on the benefits of our unique approach.
* A commitment to achieving results while instilling trust.
* You're excited for an experience selling.

**The Day-to-Day:**

* You will communicate Kingsview's value proposition to Financial Advisors to arrange home office visits..
* You will build sales skills while deepening your understanding of the financial services industry.
* You will be at the intersection of driving firm growth, controlling your career trajectory, and bettering potential clients’ financial well-being.
* You will be rewarded through competing in a meritocracy and vibrant atmosphere with like-minded peers.
* You will develop skills that allow you to succeed at future opportunities within the firm.
* Extensive travel is required

**Why Kingsview Wealth Management:**

Kingsview is a different kind of firm and we’re proud of that. We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to creative perspectives on financial planning, it’s the people that make the Kingsview purpose possible. After all, it’s our people that allow us to offer the level of service that we do. We are proud to offer.

* $100,000 Base Salary
* Uncapped Commissions
* Retirement and Healthcare Benefits
* And much, much more

Our emphasis on personal and professional growth has yielded an amazing work environment, but in the end, it’s not the perks that keep people here. They stay because they believe in our mission of service—our team wants to make a difference in an industry that can do better.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Commission pay

Work Location: In person

title: Paralegal/Legal Assistant
description:
We are seeking a Paralegal/Legal Assistant with relevant experience to join our team in our Melville, New York office. Our practice areas include Real Estate, Estate Planning, Estate Administration, Tax, and Elder Law.

In this position, you will support one or more attorneys throughout the office. Responsibilities include but are not limited to, preparing and organizing documents for probate and estate administration proceedings, preparing tax forms, and communicating with clients.

1-3 years of relevant experience in a law office is a plus, however, we are willing to train the right candidate. Position offers room for advancement and growth for the right person.

**The ideal candidate should possess the following:**

* Knowledge of tax law, and the probate process for estate administration
* Strong mathematical skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite
* A willingness to learn

title: Customer Service Supervisor (Front End Support)
description:
**Job Description**
===================

Assists with scheduling and supervision of Store Support Team Members as well with the as day-to-day flow of the department. Supports the Store Support Team Leader and Associate Team Leader(s) to ensure smooth operation of the Store Support Team. All Whole Foods Market Retail jobs require ensuring a positive company image by providing courteous, friendly, and efficient service to customers and Team Members at all times. All positions must be performed in accordance with team and store Standard Operating Procedures. Further, Team Members must be prepared and able to perform the duties inherent in other Team Member job descriptions. All positions must strive to support WFM core values and goals, promote national, regional, and store programs and initiatives, and ensure adherence to all applicable health and safety regulations including Food Safety and regulatory duties required in the department.
**Job Responsibilities:**

* Supervises and delegates tasks to Team Members.
* Works with Team Trainer to train Team Members in a manner that builds and sustains a high-performance team and minimizes turnover.
* Assists in training of new Team Members, utilizing learning checklists and training materials.
* Keeps all cases and shelves clean, well-stocked and properly rotated.
* Resolves difficult customer situations.
* Ensures all necessary breaks are given.
* Communicates team concerns to the Team Leader and Associate Team Leader.
* Communicates attendance issues or concerns to Team Leader and Store Leadership.
* Sets and achieves the highest standards of retail execution.
* Fosters and encourages a positive environment of outstanding teamwork, mutual respect, and exceptional morale.
* Maintains awareness of customer flows and needs and directs Team Members as necessary to satisfy and delight customers; responds promptly to customer needs and questions.
* Selects, trains, develops, mentors, motivates, and counsels Team Members in a manner that sustains a high-performance team and minimizes turnover.
* Provides timely, thorough, and thoughtful performance evaluations.
* Consistently communicates and models WFM vision and goals.

**Job Skills:**

* Extensive knowledge of Store Support team procedures and policies.
* 
* Demonstrates advanced product knowledge, maintains awareness of new products.
* Excellent interpersonal, motivational, team building, and customer relationship skills.
* Capable of teaching others in a positive and constructive manner.
* Product knowledge.
* Advanced knowledge of regulatory and safety policies and procedures.
* Proficient mathematical skills for assessing financial performance, monitoring profitability, and managing inventory.
* Demonstrated decision-making ability, leadership skills, and ability to prioritize and delegate.
* Proficiency with email, Microsoft Office, and operations-related applications.

**Experience:**

* 12+ months retail experience.

**Physical Requirements / Working Conditions:**

* Must be able to lift 50 pounds.
* In an 8-hour work day: standing/walking 6-8 hours.
* Hand use: single grasping, fine manipulation, pushing and pulling.
* Work requires the following motions: bending, twisting, squatting and reaching.
* Exposure to FDA approved cleaning chemicals.
* Exposure to temperatures: <32 degrees Fahrenheit (freezing), 32-40 degrees Fahrenheit (refrigerators), >90 degrees Fahrenheit.
* Ability to work in a wet and cold environment.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Ability to use tools and equipment, including box cutters, electric pallet jacks, and other heavy machinery.

**Note** : *The purpose of this document is to provide a general summary of essential responsibilities for the position and is not meant as an exhaustive list. This document does not reflect all job duties or requirements for every position. Requirements build as one progresses through the job levels, so any job duties required at a lower level may be required at the higher level in addition to the duties listed for that higher level. Duties, assignments, and other responsibilities may differ for similar positions based on business conditions, departmental or geographic location, and/or needs for the particular position. An individual must demonstrate successful performance in their current position before being considered for promotion. In addition, in order to promote into a higher-level position, a business need for the promotion must exist and the candidate must be considered the most qualified person for the new position. Completion of certain milestones such as obtaining an advanced degree or certification, time in current position, or developing skills to perform at the higher-level role do not guarantee a promotion.*

The wage range for this position is $18.00 - $24.10 Hourly, commensurate with experience. Whole Foods Market offers “Whole Benefits". Whole Benefits may include health insurance, retirement plan benefits, eligibility for a store discount, paid time off and access to other benefit programs. Eligibility for Whole Benefits is determined under the terms of the applicable Whole Benefits plan at a person’s date of hire.
***At Whole Foods Market, we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all Team Members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, marital status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely based on qualifications for the position to be filled and business needs.***

Whole Foods Market works with job sites like Indeed, LinkedIn, and ZipRecruiter to promote opportunities at our company. Please be aware that other career sites may not be accurate or up to date and may even be fraudulent. We encourage and recommend all candidates to apply via our site.

title: Lead Poisoning Inspector
description:
**Lead Poisoning Inspector - County of Bergen – Department of Health**

Under direction, performs routine work involved in inspecting residences that are suspected sources of lead poisoning does other related duties as required

**Knowledge and Abilities:** 

· Knowledge of issues involved in making investigations of suspected lead poisoning areas

· Capability in comprehension of rules and regulations

· Ability to interview individuals while using tact and courtesy in making investigations

· Knowledge of preparing reports

· Proficiency in maintaining essential records, files, and the utilizing various types of electronic and/or manual recording and information systems

**Example/s of Work –** *may include but are not limited to***:**

* Inspects buildings and dwellings for possible sources of lead poisoning
* Collects samples of paint to be analyzed by a laboratory
* Reinspects entire buildings with positive samples are discovered and collects samples from each dwelling unit for testing and reinspects dwellings after completion of repairs to ensure compliance with regulations
* Confers with individual property owners relevant to service of notices and violations
* Attends meetings and prepares reports
* Presents inspections findings in court cases
* Maintains supplies

**Schedule:**

* 40 hours per week

**Education/Licensure:**

* Applicants will be required to posses a Lead Inspector/Risk Assessor Permit issued by the New Jersey Department of Health and Senior Services
* Applicants must posses a valid New Jersey driver’s license

Please send employment application to resume@co.bergen.nj.us – ***put in subject line job applying for, thank you.***

title: Office Manager
description:
**Karash Construction Corp.**
=============================

**Office Manager**
------------------

***Candidates and Recruiters DO NOT contact Karash Construction Corp. directly. Please follow the steps to apply. All applications must go through Contractor Staffing Source.***


Are you a detail-oriented professional with a knack for organization and a passion for the construction industry? Join **Karash Construction Corp** as our **Office Manager** and be a pivotal part of our growing team!

**Karash Construction Corp** is a reputable and thriving construction company based in Monsey, NY, specializing in residential remodeling and addition projects. Founded with a passion for craftsmanship and a commitment to quality, we have built a strong reputation in our community through word of mouth and our dedication to excellence. As we expand, we are looking for a talented **Office Manager** to help us continue delivering outstanding results to our clients.


As the **Office Manager**, you will be the backbone of our operations, ensuring that our projects run smoothly and our office is organized. This role is perfect for someone with a strong administrative background in the construction industry who is ready to take on new challenges and grow with our company.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Office Management:** Oversee daily office operations, including reception, supply ordering, and equipment maintenance. Manage and organize paperwork, including contracts, permits, and compliance documentation.
* **Customer & Vendor Relations:** Serve as the primary point of contact between customers, vendors, and the field team, ensuring clear communication and problem resolution.
* **Administrative & Financial Tasks:** Handle invoicing, A/R, A/P, bank deposits, and related administrative tasks. Review time card entries, track budgets, and perform daily job costing and labor tracking via Onestep GPS.
* **Lead Management:** Manage and input leads to ensure accurate tracking and follow-up.
* **Licensing & Insurance Compliance:** Verify that all subcontractors have the necessary insurance and compliance documentation before beginning any project. Manage and maintain all required licenses and certifications for the company and its employees.
* **Project Support:** Assist in the preparation and monitoring of project budgets, and collect/organize paperwork and documents for projects and permits.
* **Marketing Support:** Assist with social media management, coordinating photographers, and preparing promotional materials, including gathering Google Reviews and testimonials.

**Qualifications:**

* A minimum of 2 years of experience in a construction office management-related field.
* Meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy in all aspects of work.
* Strong organizational, administrative, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, and Excel, and familiarity with project management software.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to solve problems effectively.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively to meet deadlines.

**Salary and Benefits:**

* Full-time
* Competitive salary of $60,000 - $80,000 per year, based on experience.
* Paid time off.
* Be part of a dynamic and growing company with a strong reputation in the community.
* Work in a collaborative environment where your contributions are valued and make a real impact.
* Opportunities for growth and development within the company as we continue to expand.


If you are passionate about construction and want to be part of a company that values quality, teamwork, and innovation, we would love to hear from you! Apply today and take the next step in your career with **Karash Construction Corp.**

title: Construction Estimator
description:
**Karash Construction Corp.**
=============================

**Construction Estimator**
--------------------------

***Candidates and Recruiters DO NOT contact Karash Construction Corp. directly. Please follow the steps to apply. All applications must go through Contractor Staffing Source.***

**Karash Construction Corp** is a rapidly growing construction company based in Monsey, NY, specializing in residential remodeling and addition projects. With a solid reputation in our community and a commitment to excellence, we've built a team that thrives on delivering quality work, exceptional customer service, and fostering a positive work environment. We are at an exciting stage in our journey and are looking for talented individuals to help us continue to grow and succeed.


We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented **Construction Estimator** to join our dynamic team. This role is vital to our growth as it directly impacts our ability to deliver projects on time and within budget. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in construction estimating, a passion for the remodeling industry, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prepare detailed and accurate construction estimates using software such as Bluebeam and/or PlanSwift.
* Analyze project plans, specifications, and blueprints to determine project costs.
* Research and source pricing from vendors and trade partners.
* Conduct site visits to gather necessary information for accurate estimates.
* Develop and maintain a comprehensive database of historical cost data and pricing trends.
* Prepare and present bid proposals, cost summaries, and scope of work documents.
* Evaluate subcontractor bids for accuracy, completeness, and competitiveness.
* Collaborate with project managers to refine estimates as project details evolve.
* Ensure all estimates align with local building codes and regulations.
* Participate in post-estimate job cost reviews to assess accuracy and identify areas for improvement.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in construction estimating or a related field.
* Strong knowledge of construction cost control principles and practices.
* Proficiency in using estimating software like Bluebeam; experience with additional tools such as PlanSwift is a plus.
* Excellent mathematical and analytical skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to read and interpret architectural drawings, blueprints, and technical documents.
* Strong communication skills for collaboration with team members, vendors, and subcontractors.
* Familiarity with local building codes and industry regulations.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

**Salary and Benefits:**

* Full-time
* Competitive salary of $75,000 - $100,000 per year, based on experience.
* Paid time off.
* Opportunity for professional growth and development.


If you are passionate about construction and want to be part of a company that values quality, teamwork, and innovation, we would love to hear from you! Apply today and take the next step in your career with **Karash Construction Corp.**

title: Pre- Construction Manager
description:
**Karash Construction Corp.**
=============================

**Pre- Construction Manager**
-----------------------------

***Candidates and Recruiters DO NOT contact Karash Construction Corp. directly. Please follow the steps to apply. All applications must go through Contractor Staffing Source.***

**Karash Construction Corp** is a rapidly growing construction company based in Monsey, NY, specializing in residential remodeling and addition projects. With a solid reputation in our community and a commitment to excellence, we've built a team that thrives on delivering quality work, exceptional customer service, and fostering a positive work environment. We are at an exciting stage in our journey and are looking for talented individuals to help us continue to grow and succeed.


We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented **Pre-Construction Manager** to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in ensuring that our projects are set up for success from the start, combining expertise in estimating with strong client interaction and project planning skills. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in construction estimating, a passion for the remodeling industry, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prepare detailed and accurate estimates for residential remodeling and addition projects using Bluebeam, PlanSwift, or similar software.
* Review and analyze project plans, specifications, and blueprints to determine project scope and costs.
* Conduct site visits to gather necessary information and validate project details.
* Collaborate closely with clients during the pre-construction phase to understand their needs, answer questions, and provide guidance on project feasibility and budget.
* Develop and present comprehensive bid proposals, cost summaries, and project scopes to clients.
* Negotiate pricing and contracts with vendors, subcontractors, and trade partners.
* Participate in pre-construction meetings to clarify project scope, budget, and timelines with clients and internal teams.
* Oversee the transition from pre-construction to active construction, ensuring all details are accurately communicated to the project management team.
* Maintain a database of historical cost data, production rates, and pricing trends for future reference.
* Evaluate subcontractor bids for accuracy, completeness, and alignment with project goals.
* Assist in value engineering by proposing cost-effective alternatives without compromising quality.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in construction estimating or pre-construction management.
* Strong knowledge of cost control principles within the construction industry.
* Proficiency in using estimating software like Bluebeam; experience with additional tools such as PlanSwift is a plus.
* Excellent client communication and presentation skills, with a focus on building trust and maintaining relationships.
* Ability to read and interpret architectural drawings, blueprints, and technical documents.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple pre-construction projects simultaneously.
* Familiarity with local building codes, regulations, and industry best practices.
* Experience in negotiating and securing competitive pricing from vendors and subcontractors.

**Salary and Benefits:**

* Full-time
* Competitive salary of $75,000 - $100,000 per year, based on experience.
* Paid time off.
* Opportunity for professional growth and development.


If you are passionate about construction and want to be part of a company that values quality, teamwork, and innovation, we would love to hear from you! Apply today and take the next step in your career with **Karash Construction Corp.**

title: Foil Fencing Coach
description:
FOIL COACH

**About Tim Morehouse Fencing Club**  
Tim Morehouse Fencing Club (TMFC) is committed to being the best competitive and recreational fencing program in the United States, with state-of-the-art facilities, cutting-edge programming, first rate instruction and professional staff.

We are committed to making all guests feel welcome at Tim Morehouse Fencing Club and to providing an environment which is always safe, clean, fun, rigorous and community oriented.

We are looking for a full time FOIL Coach to join our team in Port Chester.

**General Responsibilities Include:**

● Maintain a safe environment for all fencers and staff  
● Deliver group classes and private lessons  
● Strip coaching at tournaments  
● Traveling to local and regional tournaments  
● Solid understanding of all sports rules and regulations

● Work with a team of coaches to provide cohesive training

● Lead classes in an energetic and engaging way.  
● Demonstrated commitment to safety

● Retention and Development of Students  
● Strong leadership ability and positive attitude  
● Ability to manage your schedule  
● Communicate clearly and effectively with fencers, parents and colleagues  
● Ability to run portions of our classes including the warm-up, fencing games, club footwork exercises, club drills and supervise or referee structured bouting  
● Provide constructive feedback to fencers and parents  
● Represent Tim Morehouse Fencing Club in a professional manner

**Expectations and Requirements**

● Professional Conduct at All Times: TMFC Coaches must conduct themselves professionally at all times while at the club, on any trips representing the club and during any times when students or members are present.

● Safety Policies and Certifications: All Coaches must be Safe Sport certified and familiarized with the Club’s Code of Conduct

● USFA coach membership including safe sport and background check  
● Excellent knowledge of technical and tactical fencing skills

● Minimum 2+ years coaching experience  
● Communication with Clients and Fellow Colleagues: All staff must be available to respond to emails, texts and phone calls within a timely manner from fellow staff and client

● Deliver high quality, age-appropriate fencing coaching to our athletes at all times  
● A strong work ethic and integrity of character

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct group classes for fencers of varying skill levels, with a focus on foil.
* Provide private lessons to fencers, tailoring instruction to meet individual needs and goals.
* Develop and implement training plans that align with the club's philosophy and competitive goals.
* Attend and coach at local, regional, and national tournaments as needed.
* Collaborate with other coaches to ensure consistent and effective training across all age groups.
* Monitor and evaluate fencers’ progress, providing feedback and strategies for improvement.
* Maintain a safe and positive training environment for all athletes.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a foil coach, with a track record of developing successful athletes.
* Strong knowledge of foil techniques, strategies, and rules.
* Ability to work well with athletes of all ages, particularly youth fencers.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Commitment to the values of sportsmanship, teamwork, and personal growth.
* US Fencing certification or equivalent is preferred but not required.

**Compensation:**

* Salary is competitive and based on experience.
* Opportunities for growth within the club, including increased responsibilities and involvement in elite programs.

**How to Apply (additionally channels):** Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter detailing their coaching experience and philosophy to info@timmorehousefencing.com Please specify whether you are applying for a part-time or full-time position.

**Join the TMFC Team:** If you are passionate about fencing and have the drive to help athletes reach their full potential, we encourage you to apply to join the Tim Morehouse Fencing Club family. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Labeling Clerk
description:
If you are looking for an entry-level position within a clinical laboratory, keep reading!

Aculabs is currently looking for individuals who are excited about entering data and working in a laboratory or office setting. No prior experience or degree is required!

**Part-Time Schedule:**

* Fridays and alternating Mondays from 12:00 PM to 6:30 PM, Saturdays and Sundays from 10:30 AM to 7:00 PM

Responsible for specimen receipt and preparation, records creation, reporting of results, and transferring data to accounts receivable. Ensures all patient data is obtained and maintained in accordance with all applicable HIPAA regulations.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Enters test requisition data into the computer creating an accessioning record which includes: patient demographics and physician data, test requests, diagnosis code, and testing priority;
* Produces barcode labels
* Affixes replicates of labels to test requisition and specimen (blood or other) containers;
* Prepares specimens to appropriate departments for analysis;
* Communicates with the facility to correct, clarify, or add any information found to be in question or missing on the test requisition;
* Communicates with the Laboratory Director and/or the Compliance Officer if accessioning irregularities have not been resolved at the time of accessioning.
* Responsible for accessioning and labeling COVID-19 samples.

EEO M/F/D/V

Job Type: Part-time

title: Corporate Tax Associate (OOJ - 23834) New York, NY
description:
**Position: Corporate Tax Associate**

**Location:** New York City


**Salary Range:** $225,000 - $415,000

**Top Tier Law Firm**

**Job Overview:**


Our Client, a leading law firm, is seeking a highly skilled corporate (Transactional) Tax Associate with a minimum of 2 years of experience. This position is ideal for a candidate who has honed their skills in a large law firm or gained equivalent experience at a Big Four accounting firm. The successful candidate will bring a wealth of experience in negotiating, drafting, and advising on tax-related provisions in various transaction documents and will be adept at researching complex tax issues and structuring the tax aspects of corporate M&A and partnership transactions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Transactional Document Expertise:**
	+ Draft, review, and negotiate tax-related provisions in a wide array of transaction documents, including purchase agreements, merger agreements, partnership agreements, and credit agreements.
	+ Collaborate with deal teams to ensure that tax provisions are integrated smoothly and effectively into larger transaction agreements.
* **Tax Structuring & Planning:**
	+ Structure and advise on the tax aspects of corporate and partnership transactions.
	+ Provide strategic tax planning related to transactions, ensuring compliance with relevant tax laws and regulations while maximizing value.
	+ Engage in tax planning and structuring for transactions in one or more of the following areas: mergers and acquisitions, private equity, debt finance, bankruptcy/financial restructuring, special situations, and/or private credit.
* **Research & Advisory:**
	+ Conduct detailed research on complex tax issues, providing clear, concise, and actionable advice to clients and internal teams.
	+ Stay updated on changes in tax laws and regulations, ensuring that the firm’s clients receive the most current and effective tax advice.
* **Client Engagement:**
	+ Work closely with clients to understand their business objectives and tailor tax strategies to meet their specific needs.
	+ Communicate complex tax concepts in an understandable and relatable manner, ensuring clients are fully informed of their options and the implications of their decisions.

Qualifications

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**
	+ A minimum of 2 years of transactional tax experience at a large law firm or equivalent experience at a Big Four accounting firm.
* **Skills:**
	+ Proven expertise in drafting and negotiating tax-related provisions in transaction documents.
	+ Strong analytical skills with the ability to conduct thorough research on complex tax issues.
	+ Experience with structuring tax aspects of corporate and partnership transactions.
	+ A practice focused in one or more areas such as mergers and acquisitions, private equity, debt finance, bankruptcy/financial restructuring, special situations, and/or private credit is preferred.
* **Academic Credentials:**
	+ Stellar academic credentials from a top-tier law school.
* **Core Values & Competencies:**
	+ Future-focused with a commitment to continuous learning and innovation.
	+ Diversity-minded with a dedication to fostering an inclusive work environment.
	+ A commitment to excellence in work product and client service.
	+ Service-oriented with a strong client focus.
	+ Collaborative, with the ability to work effectively as part of a team.

Why is This a Great Opportunity

**Why Join Our Client?**


Joining our Client means becoming part of a team that values future-focused thinking, diversity, and collaboration. We are dedicated to providing our clients with exceptional service and maintaining a culture of excellence. If you are passionate about transactional tax law and are looking for an opportunity to grow your career with a dynamic and forward-thinking firm, we encourage you to apply.

*The base salary range for this position in New York City is $225,000 to $415,000.*

title: Medical Assistant - Primary Care - 1199 Union - Yonkers *Bilingual Spanish*
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a full-time Medical Assistant to join our team in Yonkers, NY.

A Medical Assistant helps patients and the clinical team at designated health center in support of medical care as directed by the nursing and medical staff and pursuant to the objectives and policies of the Center. title: Sanitation Supervisor
description:
We have an incredible opportunity for a dynamic **Sanitation Supervisor** to join our growing New York Team!

**Who We Are:** 

We have a passion for hospitality culinary delights on every banquet floor and in the sky. With the three business segments of Airline Catering, International Event Catering, and Restaurants, Lounges & Hotels, DO & CO offers gourmet entertainment all over the world. We operate in 32 locations, 12 countries and 3 continents, maintaining the highest standard of quality in both our products and services. We refine the classics, develop the unknown and grow constantly, sometimes beyond our own expectations.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Manages internal sanitation team to maintain proper sanitation and cleaning schedules, meeting DO & CO hygiene standards.
* Oversees routine locker cleaning and collaborates with the Hygiene and Quality Assurance Manager to meet company, industry, and regulatory sanitation standards.
* Works with vendors to order and maintain food-grade chemicals, ensuring appropriate par levels and coordination with other managers.
* Ensures Safety Data Sheets and Chemical Supplier Specifications are current; oversees PPE availability and training.
* Develops and maintains Standard Sanitation Operating Procedures (SSOPs).
* Verifies chemical titrations with suppliers and monitors daily chemical concentration of dispensing equipment.
* Analyzes sanitation data to identify trends and improvement opportunities.
* Provides support for customer audits, health department inspections, and other audits/inspections.
* Implements and maintains daily sanitation schedules.
* Coordinates with Food Safety and Hygiene on environmental testing.
* Develops and maintains Environmental Testing Program.
* Monitors hygiene training and staff development, providing coaching, direction, and leadership support.
* Partners with supervisors and HR to implement corrective actions when hygiene protocols are not followed.
* Oversees internal employee and client training on sanitation protocols.
* Investigates accidents, prepares, and maintains required reports.
* Maintains, reviews, and reports on quality performance.

**Qualifications:** 

* Minimum of one year of supervisor experience or in a leadership role with similar responsibilities.
* High school diploma or equivalent qualification.
* Knowledge of HACCP, ISO, and food safety systems.
* Food Safety Certification and HACCP Certificate preferred.
* Skilled in operational procedures.
* Ability to complete assigned tasks within the given time to meet strict deadlines.
* Ability to manage through a substantial workload.
* Capable of working independently and in a team environment.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Proactive and self-organized.
* Flexibility to work different shifts; including nights, weekends, holidays.
* Bilingual Spanish required.

**What We Offer:** 

* **Expected salary range: $62,500 – $65,000 annually.**
* Daily Complimentary Meals (Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner).
* Salaried employees are eligible for 401K, Commuter Benefits, and Healthcare Benefits such as Medical, Dental, & Vision.
* An organization dedicated to fostering innovation; in pursuit of cultivating creativity, embracing new ideas and leveraging our impeccable standard for hospitality.
* Genuine career development opportunities, both nationally and internationally.
* The chance to collaborate and represent a leading force in the luxury global gourmet entertainment industry.

**Diversity & Inclusion Statement:** 

We want everyone to feel welcome, respected and we are committed to providing the best space, experience, and workplace for our teams - no matter what race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and make you. That is what makes our team so special.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $62,500.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) 3% Match
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evenings as needed
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Monday to Friday
* Morning shift
* Nights as needed
* Night shift
* Overnight shift
* Overtime

title: Relay Technician
description:
**Requisition**: 77891


**PSEG Company:** PSEG Long Island

**Salary Range**: $ 42.73 - $ 59.96

**Incentive**: Not applicable

**Work Location Category**: Onsite

  

PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.


PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.


**Union Local**
---------------


IBEW 1049

***Summary***
-------------

**Company Headquarters located in Hicksville, NY.**

 ***Job Duties:***


This classification covers employees engaged in performing the highest type of independent or cooperative work in the skills indicated below. Such employees must be thoroughly familiar with the Company's safety rules and the general rules for operation of PSEG Long Island's electric system as they apply to his work.

* Having a thorough working knowledge of construction, operation and application of all electro-mechanical and solid state electronic relays, including carrier current, audio and r.f. frequency transfer tripping equipment, and the theory of their operation.
* Having a good working knowledge of all types of supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems, load control, metering and telemetering systems involving digital and/or analog principles, techniques and solid-state discrete and integrated circuits.
* Having a good working knowledge of high-speed (4800 bits per sec) digital data transmission principles and servicing techniques on all types of communications channels.
* Having a thorough working knowledge of phase and vector relations for current and voltage and the application of this information in analyzing and interpreting phase angle readings obtained at all types of relays and instruments.
* Calculate single phase and three phase KW, KVAR, KVA and power factors given system voltage, current and phase angle readings.
**Job Duties & Responsibilities**
---------------------------------

***Duties cont'd:***


Lay out and carry through jobs of the quality described below:

* Read and interpret complicated plans, drawings and specifications.
* Must have the ability to diagnose and correct difficulties and faults.
* Must be capable of preparing written reports and sketches.
* Instruct and train lower grade personnel in working methods and safe work practices.
* Working alone or with others, performs the following under the general supervision of relay engineers or supervisors:
* Applying manufacturers' instructions for testing, adjusting and maintaining equipment within his classification.
* Reading and analyzing prints, analyzing and interpreting test results, installing, inspecting, testing, adjusting, maintaining, repairing, checking and correcting wiring, and investigating questionable operations, of all types of relays, instrument transformers, metering equipment, and telemetering equipment, load Control equipment, supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) equipment, and oscillographic equipment with their associated wiring and auxiliary devices.
* Plan and coordinate work with other groups as required.
* Must have the ability to diagnose and correct difficulties and faults, analyze and interpret test results, read and interpret schematic, functional, logic diagrams and wiring prints associated with all the equipment for which the Protection Division has responsibility.
* Must be capable of preparing written reports and sketches.
* Must be able to discriminate as to circuits and equipment required to be cleared in order to safely conduct the work and execute the necessary switching operations in acordance with a duly authorized switching order.
* Having and using a thorough knowledge of the Company's Safety Rules and "General Rules for Operation of Electric Equipment and Lines".
* Must be capable of working on energized equipment without causing interruptions to service.
* Setting, testing, calibrating adjusting and repairing all types of protective relays.
* Perform similar tests as above on all primary system reclosers. These reclosers may be equipped with mechanical, hydraulic, Pneumatic, electrical and electronic control mechanisms.
* Perform all necessary system operational tests to insure proper functional performance of complete protection, control, telemetering, and supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems.
* Perform minor capital installation work from sketches or instructions on protective or control circuits as required to expedite the correction of circuit design deficiencies or to quickly satisfy system control.
**Years of Experience**
-----------------------

**Job Qualifications**
----------------------

* Associates Degree from an accredited college in Electrical Technology or Electronics or honorable discharge with an ET (Electronics Technician rate) from the Military. Applicants will need to provide a copy of their degree and a copy of their official college/military transcript.
* Possession of a valid US driver's license in good standing.
* Must pass a written screening exam.
* The successful candidate will be required to work overtime on an as needed basis and participate in the Emergency Restoration Program.
**Education**
-------------


Associate in Electric Technology**Licenses or Certifications**
------------------------------

* Valid US driver's license
**Training and Courses**
------------------------

* Relay Tech Exam.

Our office is looking for an experienced immigration paralegal who is ready to grow professionally, gain invaluable experience, and prosper with our office. 4) Preparation of SIJS Petitions for submission to the New York and New Jersey Family Courts;

title: Dental Receptionist
description:
**Department:** **Operations**  
**Reports to:** **Office Manager**  
**FLSA Status:** **Non-Exempt**

**Company Overview**  
ProSmile is the fastest growing dental organization on the East Coast and has the largest network of affiliated multi-specialty dental practices in New Jersey, with an expanding footprint in D.C, Pennsylvania and Maryland. Our premier DSO is led by world class dentists who understand what highly skilled dentists and dental professionals need to grow a practice while focusing on delivering the best-in-class clinical care to their patients.

**Position Summary**   
ProSmile is in search of an energetic, motivated, and organized Dental Receptionist with a positive attitude who is looking for growth and development in their field, and the opportunity to ascend in a growing organization that puts the care of its patients and the satisfaction of its employees first. If building your career as a Dental Receptionist interests you, and you want to work in an enjoyable and fun environment that promotes learning and teamwork, look no further. We offer up-to-date equipment and technology, training, experienced and friendly staff, and dentists who truly care about their patients. We offer up-to-date equipment and technology, experienced and friendly staff, and dentists who truly care about their patients. Our Front Desk position offers a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), training and career development, license advancement assistance, and more!

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Front Desk Receptionists are the first point of contact with our patients and should always be friendly and attentive to their needs in a timely manner
* Front desk coordination of patient flow and financial activities such as scheduling, handling patient paperwork, collecting payments and insurance cards
* Maintains reception area and inventory control of office supplies, patient literature and all related items.
* Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

Major Duties

* Manage incoming and outgoing telephone calls
* Verify and update all patient demographic data (including e-mail addresses and cell phone numbers) on the patient’s chart and in the computer
* Make a copy of insurance card and verify insurance coverage and eligibility prior to treatment
* Control and schedule patient appointments; check the appointment waiting list daily and contact patients as required; confirm patient appointments and check off patients' name if they have been contacted; ensure the next day's schedule is filled for the Providers and that patients arrive and are seated on time
* Prepare charts and schedules for the following day for each operatory
* Ensure that parents accompany minors for appointments
* Confirm appointments
* Remind a patient of pre-medication requirements if applicable
* Review all patient records for signatures on health histories, consent forms and financial policy
* Ensure that parent or legal guardian sign consent for minors
* Maintain control of all patient payments and insurance statements; reinforce the financial policy of the office and ensure payments are current
* Enter transactions and post payments at time of patient check-in and/or check-out
* Make any notes on the patient’s chart or in computer that may help others to provide better service
* Assist in directing patient recall system; send notices and telephone patients who have not been contacted; send broken appointment cards
* Maintain office-scanning system for patient records;
* Maintain Specialty Referral forms
* Manage voice-mail messages
* Communicate unforeseen schedule changes to Providers
* Ensure that the waiting room is comfortable and friendly at all time
* Contact patients regarding returned mail for accurate mailing address
* Assists Dental Practice Manager when necessary performing other assigned duties
* Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

**Qualifications**

* Must be 18 years old
* High School diploma or GED preferred
* Customer facing work experience required
* Work experience in a dental or medical practice preferred
* Experience using Dentrix, Outlook, Word, Excel preferred
* Easily able to learn new technologies and systems required
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Requires some flexibility in scheduling, such as the ability to work evenings and
* weekends as needed

**Knowledge and Skills/Expected Competencies**

* Strong customer service, communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to clearly communicate medical information to professional practitioners and/or the general public.
* Excellent organization, prioritization, follow up, analytical and time management skills with ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.

**Benefits**  
Our staff work diligently to deliver quality care to our patients. They are the key to fulfilling our mission!

Perks of being part of a team who is keen to their individual growth, our staff members can enjoy our unique benefits package including:

**Full Time**

* We provide above industry standards for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
* Competitive pay
* Health & Dental insurance
* Dental discounts
* PTO
* Paid Holidays
* 401k Retirement
* Opportunities for growth
* Continuing education
* Flexible schedule
* Training support
* Fun and collaborative environment

**Physical/Mental Demands and Work Environment**  
The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk and use hands and arms to operate general office equipment *(PC, telephone, file cabinets, copier, fax machine and printer).* The employee may occasionally lift and/or move between 10 and 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus. The employee may need to travel to healthcare practices.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.  
*The Company reserves the right to modify the job description based upon its needs and may require the employee to perform functions beyond those mentioned above. Neither this job description nor any other communication creates an employment contract between the Company and the employee.*

**Equal Employment**  
Our culture encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence, and leads in provider and patient satisfaction. Prosmile values diversity, inclusion, and equity as matters of fairness and effectiveness. We are committed to hiring and retaining a staff that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve, fostering an inclusive working environment where staff of all backgrounds feel welcomed and engaged.

ProSmile is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages applications from individuals underrepresented in the medical sector, including people of color, and persons with non-traditional work and educational experience. All who believe they meet the stated qualifications are invited to apply.

**Company Safety**  
We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. ProSmile is committed to proactively creating and maintaining an environment that is safe for our team and patients. Employees are required to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) including face masks, gloves, gowns, and more as needed and in accordance with CDC standards.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)
* Medical terminology: 1 year (Preferred)
* Computer skills: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Little Falls, NJ (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Little Falls, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: General Manager
description:
**Primary Responsibilities:**


Responsible for the overall performance of restaurant operations including customer service, financials, food quality, beverage quality, guest and employee safety practices. Oversee and coordinate the planning, organizing, training, and leadership necessary to achieve stated objectives in sales, costs, profitability, employee retention, guest service and satisfaction, food quality, cleanliness, and sanitation. Oversees all purchases of food, beverage, supplies and equipment. Regularly measure and evaluate service levels and standards using guest and employee feedback and develop plans for continuous improvement. Ensures restaurant is in compliance with all applicable federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations.

**Specific Job Duties:**


General Operations:

* Oversees and manages all areas of the restaurant and makes final decisions on guest service issues.
* Investigates and resolves food quality and service complaints. Communicates with guests and employees to solve problems and ensures complete guest satisfaction.
* Inspects dining room, food receiving, preparation, production and storage areas to ensure health and safety regulations are being adhered to at all times
* Supervises cleaning and maintenance of equipment and arranges for repairs, contracts and other services.
* Maintains appropriate restaurant image, including restaurant cleanliness, proper uniforms, and appearance standards.
* Ensures good safety practices of employees and guests throughout the restaurant. Ensures proper emergency and security procedures are in place and all employees have been appropriately trained.
* Plans, coordinates and has final approval on the scheduling of all restaurant departments.
* Prepares all required paperwork, including forms, reports and schedules in an organized and timely manner.
* Assist in developing, planning, and executing restaurant marketing, advertising, and promotional activities and campaigns. Communicates to staff and ensures all employees are aware of marketing campaigns.
* Follows all federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations outlined in the Employee Handbook


Food Safety and Planning:

* Ensures sanitary practices for food handling, general cleanliness, and maintenance of kitchen and dining areas. Ensure compliance with operational standards, company policies, federal/state/local laws, and ordinances.
* Ensures consistent high quality of food preparation and service.
* Ensure that all food and products are consistently prepared and served according to the restaurant’s recipes, portioning, cooking, and serving standards.
* Responsible for all restaurant inventories including food, liquor, beer, wine, furniture, accessories, equipment, & tool inventories and must constantly manage & maintain documented detailed status in all areas including on hand quantities, costs, & quality levels
* Ensure product is always on hand on an as needed basis, through systematic ordering and forecasting techniques.
* Ensure that all products are received in correct unit count and condition, and, deliveries are received in accordance with the restaurant’s receiving policies and procedures.


Financial:

* Ensures the receipt of all orders to verify correct quantities and pricing.
* Control cash and other receipts by adhering to cash handling and reconciliation procedures in accordance with restaurant policies and procedures.
* Reviews financial information such as sales and costs and monitors budgets to ensure efficient operation and that expenditures stay within budget limitations. Takes action to prevent deviation from budget.
* Prepare budgets as required by corporate and General Manage in an effort to meet budget projections.
* Prepare period and quarterly end budget analysis.
* Adhere to company standards and service levels to increase sales and minimize costs, including food, beverage, supply, utility and labor costs.
* Responsible for ensuring that all financial (invoices, reporting) and employee and payroll related administrative duties are completed accurately, on time and in accordance with company policies and procedures.


Employee Related:

* Provides direction to employees regarding operational and procedural issues.
* Interviews, selects and hires hourly employees. Makes employment and termination decisions.
* Conducts new hire orientations, trains employees on Company mission, culture and guest experience objectives.
* Develops employees by providing ongoing feedback, establishing performance expectations and by conducting performance reviews.
* Prepares schedules and ensure that the restaurant is staffed for all shifts.
* Continuously strives to develop staff in all managerial and professional areas.
* Be knowledgeable of restaurant policies regarding personnel, and administer prompt, fair, and consistent corrective action for any and all violations of company policies, rules, and procedures.
* Forecast & implement improvement plans for management development, & continuing education.
* Ensure all restaurant staff & management team members have necessary tools to perform daily duties.
* Communicate well all aspects of weekly operations by leading weekly team management meetings.
* Lead by example in all areas by becoming the expert in all aspects of the restaurant.
* Be a role model and a teacher to restaurant staff.


**Experience and Education:**

* Two (2) to three (3) years of restaurant management experience or one year as a Benihana manager with good performance and positive results.
* High School Diploma or GED Equivalent preferred.
* Proficiency in food planning and preparation, purchasing, sanitation, security, personnel management, recordkeeping, and preparation of reports.
* Knowledge of computers (MS Word, Excel).
* Must possess a valid driver’s license where applicable.
* Must be eligible to work in the United States.
* Must agree to background check.
* ServSafe certified alcohol service certified preferred.

INDMANAGE

title: Host/Hostess
description:
Shuka is an Eastern Mediterranean restaurant located in the heart of Soho. We focus on responsibly and locally sourced ingredients with a nod to seasonality. Chef Ayesha Nurdjaja brings an exciting and dynamic take on some of her favorite dishes inspired by her extensive travels. We serve lunch, dinner and brunch.

  

We are looking for an experienced Host that likes fast paced environments along with great energy!

  

We seek responsible, kind, hardworking individuals, with a positive and professional attitude and work-ethic. Our ideal candidates will bring genuine passion for service, hospitality, and enjoy working in a fast paced, high energy work environment.

* Be aware of regular guests/VIPs
* Organized and efficient
* Excellent communicator with the bar, service, kitchen and management staff.
* Understand all of the restaurants main dining room seating and configurations

We offer

title: Corporate Recruiter (LM)
description:
Job Title: Corporate Recruiter (Manufacturing Sector)

Job Overview:

* The Corporate Recruiter is responsible for managing the entire recruiting process for exempt-level positions across various corporate functions and manufacturing sites. This role requires strong expertise in sourcing and recruiting within a manufacturing environment, with a particular focus on Human Resources, Finance, and Marketing roles.

\\*

* Key Responsibilities:
* Full-Cycle Recruitment: Manage all stages of the recruitment process, including talent sourcing, candidate evaluation, screening, interviewing, and offer negotiation.
* Consultative Planning: Lead recruitment planning sessions with stakeholders to set expectations, establish timelines, and define the ideal candidate profile.
* Sourcing Strategy Development: Create and implement sourcing strategies; establish communication protocols with hiring managers and HR teams.
* Requisition Management: Manage 20+ open requisitions across multiple locations, overseeing the recruitment process from start to finish.
* Passive Recruitment: Source and evaluate top talent using ATS, CRM tools, online databases, and LinkedIn Recruiter.
* Alternative Sourcing: Identify and utilize innovative sourcing methods to attract high-quality candidates.
* Pipeline Management: Develop tools to manage and track candidates, ensuring measurement of sourcing strategies' effectiveness.
* Candidate Qualification: Assess candidates against job requirements using behavioral-based interviewing techniques to evaluate knowledge and cultural fit.
* Interview Process Management: Collaborate with hiring managers to form interview teams, develop interview questions, and facilitate debrief sessions for final candidate selection.
* Offer Management: Recommend and extend job offers; collaborate with hiring managers, HR Business Partners, and Compensation Partners to finalize offer details. Coordinate pre-employment checks and onboarding.
* Compliance: Ensure hiring processes comply with EEO legislation, ADA, veterans' hiring guidelines, and other government regulations.
* Team Collaboration: Serve as a key team member, acting as a brand ambassador and contributing to overall talent acquisition goals.
* Performance Metrics: Consistently meet performance metrics as defined by the Director of Talent Acquisition.
* Market Analysis: Gather and analyze labor market data, competitor hiring trends, and explore new sourcing avenues.
* Reporting: Provide regular updates and reports on recruiting progress to the Director of Talent Acquisition and hiring managers.

Qualifications:

Required:

* High School Diploma or GED equivalent.
* **Minimum of 5 years of experience in corporate or agency recruiting****,** with in-depth knowledge of HR, marketing, and finance functions within a manufacturing environment.
* - Expertise in LinkedIn Recruiter.
* - Exceptional organizational and communication skills.

Preferred:

* Bachelor’s Degree.
* Proficiency in Google Suite.
* Advanced proficiency in Workday for managing, prioritizing, and closing recruiting searches within established timelines and metrics

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $45.00 per hour

Experience:

* Recruiting: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10019 (Required)

Work Location: In person
